Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: ssg10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week and the location is great. It is right in the gaslamp south area near the restaurants, clubs, bars, and convention center. The room is nice with big bathroom, but the balcony is very small. I had the view to Hard Rock hotel and it was a nice view. I think the strength of this hotel is the location, if you want to spend time in the downtown. That was what I did. I went to enjoy the restaurant nearby and the roof-top club at the Hard Rock hotel. Enjoyed the night and just a walk back to hotel. No drinking and driving! The valet is a bit expensive at $40 (the only option).

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MMV_RJ
Reviews.Content: Recenlty I've visited San Diego for a conference held on a nearby hotel and some friends recommended the Hilton Gaslamp Quarter as the best located hotel in the neighborhood. I took the chance and I do not regret. The hotel has a great location and is within walking distance from very good restaurants, shops, and attractions, just as the Petco Park and the Horton Mall. There is a lovely park just in front of the hotel and I spent part of my Sunday there watching the dogs play. Despite some warnings on security in some neighborhoods in San Diego, I felt quite confident walking during the night in the nearby streets. The property itself is quite charming for a business hotel. People at frontdesk is very friendly and willing to help, as well as the bellboys. I received some UPS packages and the hotel personnel was very helpful in warning me and to take the boxes to my apartment. The apartment was huge and very bright. Despite the existence of a railtrack just a few yards from the hotel, I did not hear a sound coming from the trains (however, I must admit that the offer of earplugs in the bedroom were quite scaring). I read some reviews of people complaining about the noise but it did not annoy me (my room was located in the 11th floor, if I am not mistaken). The only suggestion that I would add was the unavailability of wifi internet in the bedrooms. There's only wired service which may make things a little bit harsh for someone who's sharing the room with a roommate, just I was. We needed to work on presentations and do research during the evening and it created some odd situations. There's wireless internet at the lobby, though. I did attend to the gym a few times. It is quite small, but very functional - the only downside was that there was only one treadmill working during my stay (I was at the gym 4 times); the other was under maintenaince.

Reviews.Title: “Despite price low quality”
Reviews.Author: Charl3s
Reviews.Content: Went for a couple of nights to San Diego. This hotel is wonderfully located in the Gaslamp Quarter of SD. However, there are tracks for railway and cablecars nearby. Therefore, I woke up numerous times at night when I heard the horns of the railways. This not very pleasant if you want a restful sleep. Also, the furniture and the carpet seemed to be worn. The aircon made funny noises during the night, so I switched it off and kept it running throughout the day. The cleanlyness of the room, and particularly the bathroom could have been better. The internet via cable in the rooms was relatively slow, while the WiFi in the lobby was fast and efficient. The gym is small but ok for a hotel of that size. The equipment seemed to be in order. I actually expected more luxury from a Hilton brand hotel. Despite the high price, the quality of this hotel was mediocre. On my next trip I will definitely consider this Hilton experience and rather go for other hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “If not for their customer service I would have given 0!!”
Reviews.Author: sheeba4gs
Reviews.Content: Day 1: I checked into this hotel (my visit visit to San Diego) and was given a room in the 7th floor. The toilet had stains and the tub had stains as well. The towels were a shade yellow NOT white. Since the room was big, I was like just two days I can manage. Then I opened a draw and found a half eaten chocolate wrapper & a wrapper with chocolate crumbs on it tucked into the San Diego info booklet that was provided in the room. THAT was the last straw. I called the hotel desk and asked for a cleaner room - I specifically said I did not care about noises or size I just need it CLEAN. The lady at the desk was courteous and accommodated my request immediately. A bellhop came to our room in the next 5 mins with the keys to our new room and offered to assist with the baggage. (Nice touch) Checked into the second room at 10 in the night and found out that the thermostat was broken. I called reception again with this and they offered to send an engineer . We waited for 40 mins for the engineer but a nice security guard turned up saying the engineer had left and if we were specific (????) about the thermostat we can have a room change. After 7 hours of walking in Sea World we did not have the energy to shift yet again and ended up spending the night in a room with no ventilation. Day 2: I went to the reception desk at 9 in the morning and there was another nice receptionist who listened to me patiently and assured me the problem will be fixed. When I returned to the hotel at 11 that night.. the thermostat was set at 40F. When I tried making it warmer I found it was NOT FIXED. Just tweaked to JUST work at 40F. It was so frustrating I almost cried. This time I did call them at 11 that night and requested a room change. Again.. there were courteous. helpful and apologized for the noisy room in advance and we moved into a corner noisy room which had a view.. the yellow towels , the stained carpet and the dirty bathroom counter with some hair (yhewwwwwwwwwwwwwwww) So yeah.. Pros: 1. Excellent customer service and very very helpful concierge desk services - gave us valuable suggestions for things to do at Safari park. Cons: 1. I could go on and go about the HORRIBLE broken down shabby infrastructure and I would never stop. 2. Desperately needs a revamp.Dirty dirty dirty. 3. There was NOTHING here that justified the price we paid to stay here. Absolutely NOTHING.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Rojayva
Reviews.Content: Great location in the Gaslamp District. Walk to shopping, restaurants, bars, dessert, and the Padres stadium. Nice, friendly employees who will remember you on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful area, nice hotel but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: johndfffff
Reviews.Content: At almost $400 a night, I was not all that impressed with this hotel. Admittedly, it is in a great location, direct across from the Convention Center, but I feel for this price, the hotel should be better updated, The shower was terrible, low water pressure and confusing on/off... The parking, though "Standard" for the area, was $40 a night (ouch). All in all, a nice hotel, but doubtful I will stay here again. Also, they give you ear plugs as the train comes by at all hours of the night blowing the horn. So if you have trouble rolling back over and going to sleep after you wake up, stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Location and very comfortable room!”
Reviews.Author: JackmaryRiodeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: I went with my wife to a meeting in San Diego and we chose the Hilton Gaslamp Quarter, just in front of the Convention Center, across the street. Location is one of the advantages to stay there. You are only steps from Four and Five Street, with cents of bars and restaurants and a shopping mall. The reception was polite and we weent to a our De Luxe King Bed Room, very spacious and modern. All was very clean. The bathroom was nice. Every morning you have the "USA Today" at your door. The concierge deserves a ten! They try to do all their best to help you whatever you need. Special thanks to Mr. Mike Denton, Chief Concierge, fantastic professional! The breakfast buffet was a little disappointing: it's expensive and limited, when you see that some kind of food are not replaced as has to be. And besides, the service it's not friendly! The hotel charge us for the parking garage, $40 a day (five days = $200), too expensive! And last but not least, we had heard very little the train whistle. We could sleep very well! Overall this hotel it's worthwhile and a good choice in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Great llocation- needs some finer touches”
Reviews.Author: chrissywissy100
Reviews.Content: We stayed get for 3 nights at the start of our road trip through California. We arrived straight off an 11 hour flight at 9.30 pm and our room wasn't even ready, which was quite a surprise. Rebecca (?) on the front desk was very attentive and apologetic, stored our bags and recommended somewhere to eat while they sorted it out. The next day they sent a comp cheese plate for the inconvenience, which was a nice touch. Amtrak noise can be an issue here particularly between 10pm and 3am( they blast the horn for about a mile before even passing the hotel) so definitely recommend using the provided earplugs regardless. In the main the hotel and rooms are clean, housekeeping is excellent, beds comfortable and toiletries lovely. Good location to get around with the trolley close by, taxis and gaslamp has good variety of restaurants and bars to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: cmcaudillo
Reviews.Content: The room at the Hilton was okay. It was clean, comfortable and just what I needed for not staying in my room much. The pool was fine as well. I was at this hotel for a conference and the meeting spaces were fine as well. Nothing stood out to me as being superb but it worked out for what we needed. The big plus for this hotel is the location! It is right in the middle of the gaslamp district and within walking distance to everything. Just a quick walk across the street to get to the convention center and then over the stairs and back down them to get to the Harbor Drive walking/jogging/biking trail that goes all the way to the airport along the bay. I highly recommend a stroll up the trail for restaurants and attractions like the USS Midway and ferry over to Coronado Island. I used the trail for a running path and it was great! I also got the schedule for the ferry from the concierge at the hotel and took a day trip over to Coronado Island. I walked across the island, but it is almost 3 miles across, so if you aren't used to walking that long or don't have the time, I recommend other means of transportation. The concierge was also great for restaurant recommendations and we enjoyed everywhere they sent us. We also walked up to Little Italy one day for a great meal at Trattoria Fantastico (50% off bottles of wine on Tuesdays!). It is quite a walk up to Little Italy as well, but worth it. (It is probably 2.5-3 miles walking each way) I recommend this hotel for the location if you can get a good deal and expect to be out in the city instead of shut in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great quaint hotel in the middle of the Gaslamp Quarter”
Reviews.Author: rmarquez99
Reviews.Content: This small Hilton can be mistaken for an apartment complex. We stayed there for one night and were very pleased with the room and the help that we received. The rooms are larger than the ones at the Hyatt Grand Manchester, and the location cannot be beat! The bellman even told me of a great place to park the car (parking structure next to the ballpark, in front of the omni), and its only two small blocks away. So the next time you are there forget the expensive valet parking, drop off your luggage with the bellman and run over to that parking structure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good value for a nice room”
Reviews.Author: partyrunnr
Reviews.Content: Very nice room for a Hilton. We had great service the entire time. This hotel is within walking distance of most attractions in the Gaslamp District.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of Attention to Detail, to the Point it was SCARY!”
Reviews.Author: Lilusmom
Reviews.Content: Ok, so this is hard, as the location of this hotel is perfect for you if you want to go to a ball game or the Convention Center or like me, attend a charity event at a brewery just up the street. I was on business and came with a co-worker so we shared a room. We loved walking the marina and there were tons of great restaurants to enjoy. That's pretty much all the positive I have to say which isn't really about the hotel at all but the location. There are a lot of homeless camping out at night right outside the hotel. There was some San Diego police biking the area, so it was relatively safe, just didn't make for great ambiance. For a Hilton, I expected better. The rooms were nice with exception to two things that became annoying. The lack of electrical outlets in convenient locations in the room (next to a bed for your phone charger, or next to a mirror for your hair appliances for instance). The full length mirror was on a wall next to the bed. So technically it was not full length at all and therefore useless. My co-worker and I laughed that there were two perfectly suited locations for the mirror but they chose the wall next to the bed. To their credit, there is free cable internet in each room. But the cable is visibly strung in the hallways at the ceiling. It looks so haphazard and cheezy I forgot I was in a Hilton. It looks like some guy came in and drilled a hole in the hallway ceilings and ran cable, well, actually that's exactly what happened. My scary moment came when I arrived at my room before my co-worker and got ready for bed. I was asleep for about an hour when she came in. I sat up to greet her, and to my horror there was a stranger standing in my room. Once I sat up and got a handle on the situation, I was shocked to learn that our room key was given out in error for a bachelorette party. I had the girl call the front desk immediately to stop any more keys being given out to our room and to get the right information for the party. An apology was made but the damage was already done with my mistrust of the front desk staff being able to manage important security details of guests. When my REAL roommate arrive we bolted the door. Would I stay here again? NO. I'd rather have my old favorite Best Western around the bay with a spectacular view and take a cab downtown for an event than deal with too many "little" things out of place that add up in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Boomertraveler00
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Hilton. Check-in was easy and staff was very courteous and helpful. We did have a car and used the valet parking. It was $40 a night but this was not an issue with us. The valet staff were very helpful with directions and also recommendations for eating establishments downtown. We appreciated their help. The rooms were very clean. There were ear plugs there in case you needed them. We were not bothered by the train sounds. Beds were very comfortable. There was fresh lemonade and cucumber flavored ice water in the lobby. This was a nice gesture to travelers. All and all it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Bbeballerina
Reviews.Content: The perfect place to stay if you are: attending a convention, (convention center is across the street), going to a baseball game (petco park is 2 blocks away), like to eat and shop (restaurants and stores are all in walking distance), a dog lover (cute little park is right outside entrance). I wish the rooms were a little larger, but why spend too much time in the room when you're in sunny San Diego?

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Vaney
Reviews.Content: This Hilton has a terrific location for downtown San Diego/Harbor sites, restaurants, waterfront, etc. The interior is nicely done. The rooms are pretty generic, somewhat better in the adjacent upscale section. Downsides: no wireless (good luck with your iPad); very poor in-house restaurant which had closed by 9:00 the evening I arrived; valet parking ONLY at $40.00 a night. If you are not parking and plan on dining out every meal, this is a good place to stay and access the Gas Lamp and Harbor areas. Otherwise, this part of San Diego has many other choices at similar price with more up-to-date amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't mind the trolley”
Reviews.Author: Mmmsm
Reviews.Content: We didn't mind the train/trolley noise at all - never woke us or kept us awake. I appreciated the convenience of the trolley right outside the hotel - quick ride to Old Town & Little Italy. Front desk, housekeeping and valets were all very attentive & helpful. Great breakfast, never felt rushed. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KGREENW7
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a conference, which made this location perfect, but it's great for so many other reasons. In one direction, it's a 2-minute walk to the convention center. In the other direction, it's a never-ending row of restaurants and night spots. We had Superior rooms and they were fantastic. There is a busy trolley stop outside and nightlife all around, so it can be a bit hectic, but if that's what you're after, it's perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Gaslamp area hotel”
Reviews.Author: angelinapink
Reviews.Content: Great location! I read that lots of people found it noisy here- we had a room on the 10th floor so had no problems. Lovely little pool and hot tub. Nice lobby area with wifi. Staff all very helpful.Good place to stay in San Diego. Perfect for all the bars,shops,restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a room on the other side from the train tracks!”
Reviews.Author: Joannie3112
Reviews.Content: We had three rooms, all facing the train tracks.....after the first sleepless night - one of our group changed to the other side of the hotel (I did not switch as I thought we would hear the trains whichever room we were in) - but apparently it is a lot quieter on the other side. I did mention the noise on check out and apparently it is in the works to become a 'quiet zone' - meaning no more train whistles, but not sure when that is going to happen. Location is good - right next to the Convention Centre. Service was excellent. Check in was good....the sink in one of our rooms was not working properly - went out for dinner and when we came back, it was fixed. We did not receive wine on check in. Rooms were very nice - no mini bar which surprised me. Check out was fine. We got a deal on this hotel, but I certainly would not pay the normal price. People should be informed that the hotel is situation right next to train tracks!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but watch out for the trains”
Reviews.Author: GogglesMan
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely hotel with great service and very friendly staff. The room was great, very spacious, clean and well appointed. The bed was really comfortable, very soft and begged to be slept in. However, the hotel is right next to the train line. Many, many freight trains travel on this line at night, so between the blaring of horns, the dinging of crossing guards and the banging of carriages I think I managed to get around 2 hours sleep. I stayed here once before, four years ago and had a room closer to the front of the hotel, away from the train lines. If you stay here, ask for a room at the front. Also there is no wifi in the rooms, only in the lobby. The dog park next door is good entertainment as well.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware parking is $40.00 a night”
Reviews.Author: boots279
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here . the location cannot be beat if you want to experience the gaslamp or if you are going to the convention center. you must valet park here and parking is 40 a night . as we were checking in they offered us a glass of wine which is a great way to start the weekend . we were surprised that there was no refrigerator or mini bar in the room . the service was excellent . the pool leaves much to be desired . it was not heated and the jacuzzi is tiny but the lounges are extremely comfortable to lay on. The workout room was great with ind. Tvs on the treadmills but I suggest if you really want a good workout go up and down the steps at the convention center like everybody else . Keep in mind you are right next to the train tracks so bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper. The beds were full size not queens which I'm used to . I recommend going to see the show mixed tape . it's an eighty's review show that got good recommendations and you can walk to it. Cafe 222 for breakfast. the bottom line with this hotel is what are you really looking for. If its location and service you will be pleased, if its value or a great pool area or a nice quiet room, not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dadsasdasd
Reviews.Content: A good hotel very located in a very convenient place, not full 5 star luxury as such but very good nevertheless. Review based on a five night stay in January’12 (background of spending 80+ nights per year in different hotels around the globe). (note: this is an edited version of my review, the original was malformed due to my copy/paste error…) Location: Wonderful location right in the middle of Gaslamp area but one is still able to get a getaway from the hustle since the hotel is next to a rather large park, location is especially convenient for car since very quick access to the Harbor Drive (e.g. from the airport). Countless bars, restaurants and shops right in the immediate neighborhood, quite decent deli/supermarket across the K street. Room: I received a large room in the 10th floor, certainly more than big enough for a single traveller. Bathroom was a little bit on the small side, though. Décor was rather traditional but not too old fashioned. Room was in very good shape, no signs of usage, stains etc anywhere. Two LCD TVs, safe, good desk for working. Only minor problem was that there’s no Wi-Fi provided in the room and the LAN access had some issues too. Etc: Unlike some reviewers I did not have any issues with train/tram noise despite the room facing the ocean i.e. the railway. Don’t know whether I just got lucky, room in 10th floor made the difference or don’t care that much for city noise but I had no use whatsoever for the earplugs provided. Breakfast was quite good, especially by American standards i.e. more than just doughnuts and muffins… No Executive Lounge here. Received two complimentary water bottles per stay (not per day). Valet parking was rather expensive at 40$ per day but it worked very well, never had to wait more than minute to get my car. Would I return there? Yes, sure. It’s a good hotel in a great location in wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: WaterboyGA
Reviews.Content: Exceptional service, clean rooms, friendly staff, in the heart of the gas lamp district and walking distance to everything. Expensive, but you get what you pay for. Valet parking fee is really high at $40/day. But I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - across from convention center and in Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: XLR8TOR
Reviews.Content: Fun place to stay. Explore Gaslamp district for a multitude of shops, restaurants and adult oriented clubs and bars. Short walk to convention ctr. and harbor. Nice new modern hotel. Great hot breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: st0ked
Reviews.Content: The Gaslamp is one of my favorite places for a quick weekend getaway and this hotel puts you in the perfect place to take it all in. We had no problem with noise from the guests or the rail. The room was small and the bathroom was tiny but both were modern and nicely decorated. The bed was comfy and the lighting was adequate. Now, on to why I only gave this place a 3 rating. Check In was easy but we were not supplied with any information on the hotel. The room was also sans information about on site dining or amenities. Just a couple of cute pairs of earplugs in case the train was too loud. We never did find the gym or pool. I am easy to give a little but there were a myriad of little things that added up. There was some porcelain damage to the tub that could have easily been fixed but was left ugly and staring at me when I took a shower. There were a few places in the shower that had black mold between the tiles. Again, another easy fix that was overlooked. The room and bathroom seemed fairly clean but the shower had black hair on the walls left behind from a previous guest. Ewww, The door to the bathroom had a broken closer at the top that just hung out dirty, rusted and useless. I'm not quite sure why it was there in the first place because even without it, the door would only stay in the closed position. Parking has gone up to $40 and for the money, I thought that the attendants were a little rude.(for $40 bucks you can open and close the door for me) So Hilton Gaslamp could have been good but it was just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location for Convention Centre”
Reviews.Author: rd4boy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for conference at Convention Centre December 2011. The hotel is the closest of any to the Centre - including the 3 large hotels on the waterfront - and I would choose to stay there again purely for that reason. It is also convenient for the Gaslamp Quarter and its entertainment options. The hotel is small but comfortable and has sufficient amenities. I had a room facing the railway tracks and was not bothered at all by noise from there. I agree that there is a bit too much noise audible from the hallways but that is not unique to this hotel! Overall I recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Convention Center, but very loud!”
Reviews.Author: TravellinJay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient to the convention center. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the room was in good condition. My biggest complaint about this place is the noise. Noises from the hall are easily heard (moreso than in other hotels - don't know if it's thin doors or what). If you have a room facing the courtyard, you will hear a lot of noise from people outside. Last, but definitely not least, you will be subject to loud and long train whistles due to the nearby railroad crossing. Even if you are not a light sleeper, you might want to bring earplugs or ask for an upper floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for the convention centre”
Reviews.Author: OrionSouthEngland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a conference in the convention centre. The hotel is located about 5 minutes walk from the San Diego convention centre right on the edge of the Gaslamp district. It is therefore very convenient. As other reviewers have noted, tramway and railway lines run alongside the hotel. I was on the 10th floor of the hotel (I paid $5 per night for a room on a higher floor) and did not hear the tram but unfortunately the Coaster train was not able to pass through without repeated sounding of its horn which could be heard clearly on the 10th floor. I suspect that most hotels near the rail track including the Hyatt and Marriott would similarly suffer. As for the Hotel itself, we were very well attended to on arrival and the receptionist even arranged for a room fridge to be provided. The room was well-appointed and sufficiently spacious. There were plenty of pillows and the mattress was perfectly comfortable - and absolutely among the best I've experienced. Top marks! I did not eat in the hotel but did enjoy the lemonade provided in the lobby each afternoon. The only real downside to the hotel was the appalling internet service. Neither the Ethernet nor the wifi permitted access to MS Outlook email downloads. This is very poor for a hotel serving a number of clients staying on business.

Reviews.Title: “We had a very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: _Mundo_Traveler_11
Reviews.Content: We liked our room and the breakfast in the morning. Also, the location is excellent. Mike in concierge was helpful to us. Overall, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice retreat”
Reviews.Author: GabrielleGW
Reviews.Content: The day we arrived I was very sick with the flu. The girl who checked me in I think her name was Anna asked me if I needed anything to make me feel better. She sent me a pot of hot water which made it to my as I was opening the door. It was so nice that I did not have to wait or call to check on it. The room was very clean all of the staff were super nice. It was perfect. I wish I could have enjoyed it more I would have loved to go to the spa. The room service dinner was really good and came quickly. I got my car quickly. This Hilton is on my list to go back to when I go down to SD!!!

Reviews.Title: “watch your bill AFTER you leave”
Reviews.Author: Leesawyzard
Reviews.Content: loved the hotel, valet was great, front desk was awesome, room was great, comfy beds, quiet area, great experience . . .until a few days AFTER our visit and I noticed an additional $75 billed to my credit card! WTH? We called the hotel to find out we were being charged for using both bottles of water (huh? didn't touch them) and what was the $75 for? we were told it would be credited back to our card. it is charged just in case they need to charge you for anything. Oh My Goodness! Seriously? hmm, way to taint a good experience Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Went above and beyond for us on one of their busiest nights of the year!”
Reviews.Author: MMGLA
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for New Years Eve because it is across the street from a party I was going to (Big Night Out San Diego--which I also recommend). My friends and I booked a deluxe double double room back in November because we knew that hotels in San Diego sell out for New Years Eve. However, when I checked in, I was told that I had a room with one king bed. I'm not a picky traveler, and I usually just go with the flow. But I had reserved two beds (for quite a bit of money) very far in advance and was not okay with being given a room different from what I reserved. After looking into our reservation, it was discovered that the booking company we had gone through was responsible for this mix-up--not the Hilton. It being New Years Eve, they were unable to provide us with a room with two double beds (as all rooms of that type were sold out). It was explained to us that since we had booked through a booking site, they couldn't refund us any money. It did take some time, but we were finally were told that there was a room available with a king size bed and a pull out couch bed. Obviously pull-out beds aren't very comfortable, but this was an upgraded room with a view and our options were limited. I was content at this point. However, Jason K. at the front desk went above and beyond to apologize for the inconvenience. After our new years' celebration, we returned to our hotel to find a complimentary bottle of wine, cheese plate, cracker plate, and hand written note from Jason (who had handled our situation earlier) apologizing for the inconvenience. The hotel was very nice, but it was Jason's extra effort that impressed me the most. If the rest of their staff is anything like him, I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone!

Reviews.Title: “A good Hilton property in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Keith032
Reviews.Content: I'm sure most people who stay at this Gaslamp District hotel are conventioneers for an event across the street at the San Diego Covention Center. My wife and I came for a holiday break between Christmas and New Years. It wasn't crowded, but was pleasantly busy. Our room, 637, was recently remodeled and had a comfortable bed. My only complaint was the lack of wireless Internet in the room. Nearby railroad noise was not an issue for us, but if you are sensitive to noise, ask for a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Location + Staff=Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay86
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is just perfect! You literally step outside the hotel and you are within a very short walking distance to hundreds of restaurants, bars and shopping. When checking in, we were given room on 12th floor overlooking the convention center and the little park out front. It was perfect and did not hear any noise at all from the train. It was Christmas eve so it was pretty quiet in the hotel. We even received a small bottle of wine as I am a Hilton Honors member. Nice touch. The breakfast buffet was good also with fresh squeezed orange juice (yummy) and made to order omelette . All staff that we encountered were very friendly and polite. We enjoyed watching people walk their dogs and bring them to the little park out in the front of the hotel. We took a taxi to/from the airport and found this to be perfect instead of renting a car and paying the parking fee. The only small thing that I was disappointed in (VERY SMALL) is that there were no 'on demand' movies. When I stay at a hotel, I love sleeping in and catching up on movies that are sometimes even still in the theaters. There was Direct TV though with plenty of channels. All in all, a very nice stay and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice location”
Reviews.Author: txleong
Reviews.Content: If you like a smaller more intimate hotel instead of a mega convention style hotel, this is a great option. Right there in the gas lamp district so walking to all the restaurants and shopping are at your doorstep. Convention center is right across the street And you. An hear the trolley drive by outside your window.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: may0529
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved staying at the Hilton Gaslamp. Being Hilton Honors Members We got a room that overlooked the little park in front of the hotel. Loved that we got to see the train go by and watching people strolling along. We loved the valet here. The guys were extremely helping and sweet. The moment we pulled up they opened our doors for us,got our luggage out, took us in and escorted us to the checkin. The man who brought us to our room told us about room service and how great the chicken wings were. He even reccommended a couple a great nearby places to eat. I accidently left my phone and a few other things in the car the valet guys were nice enough to bring my fiance down to the car to get my things and bring him back up. We loved the room service there and there breakfast. Our first day we had breakfast downstairs, my fiance absolutely loved their eggs benedict. Good breakfast buffet to. That night we had room service and I was surprised by how good all the food was. The pool is small but still amazing you can hear the music from nearby bars and its really romantic out there!!IOther couples were out there too relaxing and drinking while watching the night sky! I even got engaged out there. Perfect setting for it if you time it correctly. The next day the entire hotel seemed to know that we were engaged they gave us a really cute quiet spot in the breakfast area. All the staff were congradulating us and it truly felt like an amazing experience. Couldn't have asked for a better weekend myself

Reviews.Title: “No in room wifi”
Reviews.Author: CeeBee130
Reviews.Content: Isn't California the meca of information technology ? So why only wifi in the lobby ? And the cable internet is not Vpn friendly. So I lost a day of work, but i was able to discover the gaslamp district. Well located for that purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, expensive”
Reviews.Author: ydrone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Saturday night recently. The location is perfect - bars, restaurants, and clubs are within walking distance. The bill for the night was $200. It included a $36 parking fee but nothing else in terms of amenities - i.e. no breakfast, not even coffee, is included. Bottled water in the room, should you wish to use it, is $3.50. And my room didn't even have a refrigerator! (I'm scratching my head at that one - because clearly there was a cabinet space designed for it.) Actually they provide a pair of earplugs, presumably for noisy nights. Basically an overpriced Motel 6 and minus the continental breakfast. If it wasn't for the great location, I'd bring it down 2 notches. Note, parking on the street is free starting Saturday evening and all day Sunday. So make sure to get into town after the free parking begins. I probably would have chosen a cheaper hotel if my company wasn't picking up the tab.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SoCalTraveller30
Reviews.Content: Really great place to stay. Convention center is just across the street, restaurants and bars all over the place. Parking is a little steep at 36 for valet or you can just park two blocks away on the weekend for 8-9 dollars a night if you aren't going anywhere... Breafast buffet is ok for $20 bucks if you don't want to go anywhere. They make fresh omlettes for you, and the usual bacon, potatoes, muffins and bagels are available with fruit etc.. Bed was really comfortable, clean large room and staff were really friendly. Wish they had WI-FI in the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Classy Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: WRich
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel well served by a number of quality local restaurants. The breakfast is good and the staff are friendly. Yes there's a railway outside and the drivers like to sound their horns, but I don't remember being woken up by this, and I had a room at the front of the hotel which I imagine would be in the noisiest spot. They do provide earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “The absolute closest hotel to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: nawirl
Reviews.Content: This is 1 block from convention center near train, famous Gaslamp District, wonderful running trail. The hotel is small in comparison to the others in the same 2 blocks. Omni, Hard Rock, Marriott, Embassy. It was just a tad cheaper than the others. The bed was very comfortable. Thats about the only good thing I can say about the room. There is no wi-fi in the rooms. They do have ethernet hook-up at the desk. I'm spoiled with wi-fi. There are so many restaurants in the area you are bound to have leftovers. After a $50 solo meal I am not leaving leftovers at the restaurant. Unfortunately when I opened the mini fridge cabinet there was NO fridge. For $200 a nite I want a freaking mini-fridge. My friends did have a room where the windows opened all the way and that was very nice -room 732. My window opened about 2 inches- room 338. It was a nice enough hotel but I wont be staying here again. I have stayed at the Omni and the Hard Rock across the street and would stay there even with the slight price increase.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Gaslamp San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Sonya M
Reviews.Content: Before booking your stay at this hotel, be warned. First, the hotel has some really interesting policies related to rate increases and extreme minimum stays during conventions and holidays. Further, there is a park next to the hotel that is a prime area for the homeless, panhandlers, and a guy who likes to play the trumpet badly for approximately 2 hours everyday. The Hilton staff made it clear to us that they do not own the park and refuse to even report incidents that occur in the park to the police. Although the location is excellent, book at your own risk. I would recommend the Residence Inn a block and half away instead. Much better rates and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trolley and Train viewing!”
Reviews.Author: KateS7
Reviews.Content: As a reward for a job well done, I took my adult son on an Amtrak trip to San Diego. He loves trolleys and trains and so I selected our hotel carefully to take full advantage of the adjacent trolley station. I requested a room overlooking the station and it was perfect. My son was either riding the rails or popping out of his chair every time he heard the bells of the gate going down signaling the arrival of a new train. The hotel did give us earplugs but we didn't need them at all. In addition to the trolley,two freight trains made their way through downtown San Diego quite late at night. We also enjoyed nearby restaurants particularly a fish place in the trolley plaza. Petco Park, home of the Padres, was a block or so away and we were able to take in a game while in San Diego as well as watch fan trains arrive and depart. The only downfall to the hotel was no late evening service in the restaurant. Hotel staff told us it was open and after making our way through several children playing with a stroller in the bar (between the lobby and restaurant) we found the place deserted. All in all, we came to watch and ride trains. This Hilton didn't disappoint, it was clean and comfortable and offered all the train viewing my son could stand. We were right in the middle of the Gaslamp Quarter and the convention center is across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: ShopSD
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Hilton in the Gaslamp district this past week and have only good things to share. At check in the staff was beyond courteous and helpful. As a member of the Hilton members club, they gave us complimentary wine. For lunch, their helpful valet staff, recommended a fish taco stand around the corner from the hotel- which was fabulous (even if the exterior of the place would not suggest so). Our rooms were neat, with contemporary decor. The bed skirts were a bit dirty, but otherwise everything was clean. We even checked the mattresses for bed bugs--none to be seen. The location of the hotel was pretty amazing too. Right next to the convention center and walking distance (1-2 blocks) to restaurants and bars. We walked everywhere and the scene was pretty lively at all times. There is one draw back to the location. If you are a light sleeper or cannot stand loud noise, this is not a good location for you. There are train tracks right outside of the hotel rooms, with freight trains passing hourly (or sometimes more). When the trains pass, their horns are often used and the sound is annoying. It wasn't a big deal for me, but I'm not a light sleeper. The room window are double enforced to keep out sound, but they do keep it at a minimum but you cannot ignore them. This hotel is not the only one with this issue, the Omni and Marriot which are next to the Hilton, face the same issue.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room!”
Reviews.Author: Burke_Surfer
Reviews.Content: I just spent the night here and am getting ready to leave - very reluctantly. I'm nearing the end of a long business trip in CA and this hotel was the best one of the stay. The room I was in was large and comfortable and the staff - Evelyn at the front desk in particular - were all marvelous. I heard the trains before going to sleep, but once asleep, I didn't notice them - and I skipped the earplugs. When I return to San Diego, I'm definitely coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great conversion property in a GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: lanzmo
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Gaslamp area and the Hilton Gaslamp. We had booked a suite and due to a Military Ball the hotel was at capacity. We are Diamond so they upgraded us to a Junior Presidential which was great!(sans the noise at night hence the earplugs next to the bed). Our room was in the "lofts" section which is adjacent to the main building. If going to a Padres game or this general area I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Famishedtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks much better in the photographs. I am a diamond member of Hilton and have to say, this is not one of their top properties. It is a great location in the Gaslamp district, right across of from the convention center, all of the restaurants and next to the trolly stop. Easy walking to the beach and seaport village. That being said, I think the Marriott or even one of the other Hiltons would be nicer. The hotel is fine, and if you have to stay there it's not a bad choice but not what I expect from a Hilton-- it was a little old and dated and we were even upgraded to a suite. Oh, and being right next to the train tracks can be noisy at night although didn't bother us. They actually provide ear plugs for those on that side of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Got Lucky - Not too many issues with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Shotlady
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel to attend meetings across the tracks at the SD Convention Center. Since most of our convention activities centered around and above halls E, F and G, its just a few minutes walk away, yay! I stated in the title that we got lucky because my roommate arrived a day earlier than I and was able to get us a room on the 12th floor toward the end of the building facing northeast and away from the tracks and the associated noise (yes, there were earplugs in our room). Nice good sized room with safe and in room coffee maker, comfy double beds, lovely view, HD TV but no refrigerator. Bathroom is kind of small to me. Aside from the dim hum of the AC units neither one of us were disturbed by the train, street or Hard Rock music noises. I might not have the same opinion if the room was located across the hall or on a lower floor, however. There was a long line at the check in counter when I arrived, so I stored my luggage at the bell desk so I could attend a meeting. When I returned, the luggage was up in my room in less than 5 minutes from my call and an extra luggage rack per request. Good service in the bar area too. Only ate in the New Leaf restaurant once for a quick breakfast - 8.75 for two eggs and an english muffin. I am going to be reimbursed for this stay but $36 per night for valet parking - come on now! Well at least it was "covered parking". My friend stayed at the Marriott Marquis across the tracks next to the convention center and self parking "out in the open" parking lot is $26 per night, so all you tourists with cars better take this in to consideration when staying at the Gaslamp/Convention area. I wouldn't recommend this Hilton to the average tourist family but for people attending conventions remember to request a room on a high floor and opposite the train tracks. Don't forget if you are driving that there is no self park option at this hotel and the valet cost of $36 per day must be factored in to your total costs.

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to Hilton standards”
Reviews.Author: riphensh
Reviews.Content: Nice location. Other reviews note the train noise, but that was only a factor on the first night and only at 9 and 10 PM. The noise issue we had last night were from the ridiculously loud partiers outside at 1:30 AM. Surprised that on the 4th floor we could still hear it from street level. Bottom line, as a full scale Hilton property, it is missing the extras I've come to expect. The good: 1. Nice location in gas lamp quarter. 2. Very polite hotel staff The issues to fix: 1. Staying with my wife and two daughters--twice in the first three nights I've had to ask for extra towels (total of 4). 2. First night had to ask for extra sheets for the couch. Very surprised that in a suite the couch is NOT a sofabed. Didn't expect that, probably should not have assumed so. 3. Maid service appears to be ok, but for the first 2 days, a water glass my daughter used was left on the table full and remained so, with the "Hilton" cover on it, after the housekeeping was finished. Not replaced with a clean glass. Now it has become an experiment to see if it will last the third day. 4. Typically at Hilton's there are robes in the rooms for use. Not here. 5. Very slow service at breakfast--had to ask each day for extra coffee and waited usually 10-15 minutes for the bill, which was slow considering the restaurant was only 1/3 full. 6. Bathroom shower head--VERY dirty, caked with hard water deposits. Either replace or clean. 7. Wireless internet access only available in the lobby. Free internet hotel wide, but what if not travelling with a laptop? Bottom line--Being SPG Gold and Hilton Gold, I spend enough nights at hotels to know that it's the little things which set a hotel apart. While I appreciate the location, the lack of attention to details has me concerned. I tried to email the GM on Thursday to express my concerns, but must have guessed his address wrong, as there has been no response yet. Would I return? Not sure. Do I recommend this? Based on the location and reputation Hilton has, I would give this place only 2.5 stars and warn people to have appropriate expectations. The little things DO count.

Reviews.Title: “Boogie Woogie Choo Choo All Night Long”
Reviews.Author: Robert F
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Gold Member. I am in my second night of a four night stay here. Probably will never come back. Never before been in a hotel that provides you with ear plugs in your room to block out the train whistle at midnight and again at 6 AM. Housekeeping left garbage on the floor and left half the number of towels on the second day as I had when I got here. I wonder if I will have any towels tomorrow. No refrigerator in the room. $36 per day for valet parking is highway robbery regardless of what downtown parking availability is. There is no self-parking at the hotel. Several times we went to get questions answered by the concierge and there was no one at the desk and no one to be found. There are plenty of hotels in the same area that one can choose from and next time I will choose something where I don't feel like Joe Pesci in "My Cousin Vinny" asking about the train coming through every night.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: latte4me
Reviews.Content: Was here for business - not my first time at the hotel - and was surprised to see the property was a little, well, ragged and worn. (personally, I wondered if the newer Hilton down the road is getting all the love...) Room service food was marginal, and even though I have gold status with Hilton, I was uncertain what benefit I should have been receiving for it. And not to be too picky, but the fact that there's no wi-fi in the rooms (common area in lobby only) makes it unlike most properties, new OR older. Oh, and when the concierge isn't there (and they keep limited hours), nobody seems to know anything. The noise from the train - which I faced - wasn't too much of an issue as I've stayed in this area many times and have grown used to it. BUT - the thumping loud music from the Hard Rock hotel, which I was told can go on until 1:30 a.m.? Not cool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AudreyWP
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location. Arrived at the hotel and was checked in with no issues, Once we arrived to our room we had been given a room with one king size bed and we needed 2 double beds, The bell boy was amazing and rectified the situation right there and got us the room we needed without having to go back down to reception. that was some great service. The concierge also provided us with great walking maps and recommendations for restaurants. The rooms were exactly what you expect from a Hilton Hotel, Clean, spacious and comfortable. Location is right in the gaslamp district with many restaurants and shops and also just across from the boardwalk and convention centre. The only strike about this hotel is that our room was located facing the tram railway and the tram drivers seem to like to blow their whistles at night which is a bit annoying, luckily the hotel does warn you about it and provides earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: rdkell
Reviews.Content: I have stayed all over downtown San Diego (Grand Hyatt, Omni, Embassy Suites, Sofia) and this is now my favorite hotel. I'm limited by expense reimbursement limits so I often find myself using Hotwire & Priceline, but would love it if I could stay here every time. The location is fantastic, right at the very start of the Gaslamp Quarter's two main streets. Easy walking to hundreds of restaurants & bars. It is also directly across the street from the convention center. My room was modern, extremely clean, had large windows and a great view of the convention center and the bay, and has a very large (guessing 40") HDTV with HD programming. Bed was very comfortable, very nice sheets and comfortable pillows. I didn't eat at the hotel but stopped into the bar about 10 or so and ordered a drink, bartender was helpful and friendly. Overall I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay with stellar customer service!”
Reviews.Author: KingHollis
Reviews.Content: We arrived slightly early but Nytsa was able to readily accommodate us in the loft jacuzzi suite we had reserved. The suite was very well appointed and spacious. The setting provided us with a great street view outside. Unlike others who complained about the train noise, we slept peacefully and weren't bothered at all by any noises. Would definitely recommend this place and it will be my "go to spot" in San Diego from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for conference center”
Reviews.Author: Kopitraveler
Reviews.Content: Right across tracks from convention center. No taxis, walking everywhere. Sure, train tracks nearby, but if you live in a city, and sleep with taxis, etc, noise, no big deal. Breakfast buffet excellent, a little pricy but well worth it. Try and book a deal which includes breakfasts. Bell staff is fabulous, resourceful and helpful. Bar makes one heck of a fresh watermelon margarita, on the rocks, of course! Would stay again. Room - comfy bed and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable noise level due to train”
Reviews.Author: ose_2000
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is actually a very nice hotel and very conveniently located. Rooms are nice and clean and the hotel offers free and relatively reliable internet. There is a major downside though: When building a hotel right next to a train track that has whistling trains running frequently it is totally unacceptable to have windows/walls that are not properly soundproof. Offering ear-plugs to guests is an insult rather than a nice gesture and shows that hotel management is well aware of the shortcomings of its property but unwilling to deal with them. Interestingly I stayed there the same day USA Today had a full-page article on travellers suffering from noise at business hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Less than thrilled”
Reviews.Author: torp
Reviews.Content: I was less than thrilled with my stay here. The room was nice, the decor was modern and tasteful but there was no refrigerator in the room, and I like to keep cold drinks in my room. The complaints are all about the money. To me $36 a day valet parking is unreasonable, as is a $19.95 breakfast buffet with cold scrambled eggs. In my opinion there are plenty of nice hotels in San Diego that offer more amenities and a much more competitive price.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent property in the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: simonallardice
Reviews.Content: I want to start first with the staff at this hotel; simply put, they're second-to-none. They're engaging and charming and almost worth the visit itself, nothing is too much trouble and they made me feel very welcome and valued. This property really knows how to look after their Diamond VIPs and for that I'm most grateful. The property itself is great, the lofts if you can land them are amazing and I didn't find that there was any over-bearing noise from the active and funky gaslamp district right outside the window. Location wise, whether you're visiting for a convention, or just visiting then the location is brilliant. Across the road from the convention center and practically in the heart of the gaslamp district, or at the beginning if you're splitting hairs. If you're looking for a super cheap, but reasonable bite to eat while their, then head to McCormick & Schmicks in the Omni for their Happy Hour....$2.95 for an excellent cheeseburger, unbeatable. All in all, a mighty fine Hilton property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and friend staff”
Reviews.Author: 12VoltMan-Chitown
Reviews.Content: The location can't be much better!. Right at the start of the Gas Lamp district. Room was average size.. nothing fancy but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton Ever, Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: 2travelforever
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, near shopping, food and the ocean. Across from convention center. My room had 2 big windows, yet very quiet inside. The best part was the breakfast. Goes until 11:00 and it is amazing! Freshly squeezed juice, made to order eggs and the fruit filled yogart was perfect. So much to eat, I didn't even miss lunch. The dinner was also great. Love the chef. Not to be missed if you need to stay in San Diego. Only negaive, 35.00 for parking, but we just parked on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Broken”
Reviews.Author: SDdan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the day before and day of my wedding. I live in San Diego but we wanted to be downtown closer to the action. This hotel is right on 5th Avenue in the heart of it all. Great location. There was a long line to check in with no special HH line. Having diamond status, I was upgraded to a loft. It was a huge room. But it was in need of a renovation. The bathrobe layed out on the bed was dirty, it had someones hair in it. Some of the towels were stained and fraying. That evening around 1am when I got ready to sleep, I tried to find the switch to lower the shades. Since this is a loft, the windows went up 2 stories and the only way to lower top the shades was through a motor. I couldn't find the switch so I called down to the front desk. I was informed that the motor was broken and wouldn't be replaced for another week. So there was no way to lower the shades. Why wasn't I informed of this when I checked in. How could they be utilitizing a room that the shades can't close. I asked to be given another room, but they told me the hotel was full. I asked what other compensation could they offer. After much discussion, the only thing they offered was free parking. When I received my bill at the end of the stay, they only comp'd 1 night of parking. But that time I was off to my honeymoon and didn't want to fight it. Bottom line, even with the great location I would not recommend this hotel. It's dirty, needs repair and the staff is not responsive to their customer's needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Great Staff - I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: brian r
Reviews.Content: Came here for a conference at the convention center which is across the street. Happened to be here when the whole county lost power mid-afternoon until 1:30am. I was on the 12th floor but this place had things running smooth. The bar was open and they were keeping track of tabs with pen and paper. They had flashlights for everyone and sandwiches available. They had lights on in the hallways and 1 elevator running. No one was stressed or running around crazy. It was very impressive. Friends were at neighboring hotels and had the complete opposite experience. Outside of this - the room was great, the bed comfortable and the food recommendations were great.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: heeler1
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel for the business traveller, for anyone attending a conference in the San Diego conference center or if you find yourself in San Diego for a weekend. Overall a decently appointed and comfortable hotel in the mid range of pricing. Rooms were clean and comfortable with adequate bedlinens, good pillows and a pretty well appointed bathroom and shower. In room coffee is available but not fantastic. There is an issue with an evening train that passes virtually beside the hotel each night and the conductor of that train does love the whistle. However, it was early enough in the late evening/early night to not be much of a bother for me. If a once per day train is something that will ruin your stay, then best to reconsider. The restaurant in the lobby was a very decent breakfast place, although not cheap, and there may well be better cheaper fare in the outstanding surrounding neighbourhood. But, I went for it for convenience alone. For the first time in awhile I did not use gym or pool facilities so cannot comment. The best thing about this hotel is its location in the coveted Gaslamp district. It is an easy walk to everything. There are several really excellent restaurants virtually steps away and a pleasing and safe feeling night community to walk about in. The Hornby shopping mall is an easy walk away. Cab to and fro the airport only about 12 to 13 dollars. 12 bucks by cab to the San Diego Zoo. There is a deli/market steps from the door. Hotel staff were attentive and friendly. A good solid place to stay in a remarkably good location.

Reviews.Title: “Its all about location.”
Reviews.Author: Travelergirl73
Reviews.Content: The convenience of the hotel from train, shops, restaurants is fantastic. But...I would never spend that amount of money on the hotel again (unless there was a deal). If you expect an amazing spacious room with a large bathroom, you're in for a disappointment. The room is very plain (putting it nicely), and the bathroom is no bigger than a closet. Please look at the pictures from the hotel and you'll see what I mean. If you're simply staying for conferences then i'm sure this hotel will "suit" your basic needs. But if you're a 30's couple like us who enjoy a nice comfortable hotel, then don't waste your time. The bed was king size and very comfy. However the maid service will only change your sheets every 4 days or when you check out. If you require more frequent change of linen, then don't forget to leave the card on your pillow. I do have to say that the front desk/ concierge service was great! They were very accommodating when I asked for a room facing away from the convention center/train. The train goes by very often at night and it can be hard to sleep (they do provide you with earplugs, but this won't help unless you're a deep sleeper. We were celebrating a romantic honeymoon/getaway, and were warmly treated by the staff! Thank you! Other than that, the hotel is just average. If you're expecting the same level of quality and style as from other hilton hotels, you're going to be disappointed. I would spend the extra money on a sheraton 4star hotel and get the impeccable level of quality hotel service/hospitality as you would staying at a fairmount hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Indyblonde
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the best location if the Gaslamp Quarter is what you want. It sits right at the foot of the quarter, with perfect and easy walking access to everything. It's also a few blocks from the train station, so we just walked from there and didn't have to bother with a car. The street is noisy. They warn you in advance. And even provide little ear plugs at bedside. The trolley clangs and there's lots of cars and people. But this is a city, so it's to be expected and the thick windows do help a lot. But if you're a sensitive sleeper, forget it. I would say that it would be better named Hilton Garden Inn in terms of the decor, carpeting, etc., but all in all it was a good stay. We loved the Gaslamp Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JMUstu01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel to attend a wedding and enjoy some of the San Diego night life...great spot! Easy walking distance to lots of great restaurants and bars/clubs. The hotel itself was average for a Hilton. Looked fairly new or recently remodeled. Rooms were nice and quiet. The beds were comfortable. My room had a sliding door that opened which was quite nice given the great climate in San Diego. Other than the AC not working very well during the days (it seemed very underpowered), I had no issues. A few warnings...there is no wireless internet in the rooms...wired only so if you have a MacBook Air or other laptop that does not have ethernet, bring an adapter. There is free wireless in the lobby. Also the business center does not have actual computers...only hookups for your laptop AND they charge you by the minute for using your own laptop. This is not typical for a Hilton. Otherwise, great trip. I would consider staying here again on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: acdhuber
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located, directly across from the San Diego convention center with easy access to the dining and shopping options available in the Gaslamp quarter. The room, itself, was average, as was the hotel. We could hear street sounds, even with the windows and sliding door closed, particularly after the baseball game concluded. I would recommend the hotel for its location, and it was decent for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Lew44
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location for us and our teenage daughters. We were able to walk to restaurants and shops in the Gaslamp Quarter as well as to a good sized shopping mall. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Our lounge waiter even offered to look up some ball game info for us on our first night. Loved the free appetizers in the lounge during the week! The included breakfast buffet was very good and the morning waiters outstanding! We did not hear any train noise at all even though there were ear plugs provided in the room. (Room 432) The pool area was small but had plenty of chairs for suntanning and towels were provided. Rooms were a good size and coffee and tea were provided as well as a mini fridge - nice to have! Walking distance to a Ralph's grocery so we could stock up on fruit and snacks. Right across the street from the convention centre - very convenient for attending a conference. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfort and care.”
Reviews.Author: SP W
Reviews.Content: Spent four days at the end of July 2011and throroughly enjoyed our stay. Judy and her hotel staff were very accommodating and the Valet parkling with Zach and others were quick and easy. The location, in the Gaslamp District, was very convenient, next to great restaurants, entertainment, Petco Park, the Convention Center and Marina. Used the pool, hot tub and fitness center daily; it was clean and well maintained. The rooms were spacious and the beds very comfortable. Will definitely stay there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: thenfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 6 nights. I cannot say enough about it. The staff was very hospitable and accomodating. The room was clean and comfortable. The daily breakfast was wonderful and the staff friendly and prompt. I had read reviews about the noise from the train but we never noticed it. Rebecca took care of us at check-in and put us in the "quiet side" of the hotel. The only thing was one of the elevators smelled throughout the stay so we just avoided riding in it. Parking is a bit steep at $36 per day but the valets are prompt and courteous. Nice location. Close walking distance to everything. In hindsight I would not rent a car unless you are traveling far from immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Trikadoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel fit all our needs. We didn't rent a car so having a hotel located within walking distance of great restaurants and sights was perfect for us. I requested a "quiet" room and we never heard the trains. All rooms come with earplugs, we didn't need them. The one downside was they only had wireless internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “just average at best”
Reviews.Author: missinglondon2010
Reviews.Content: obviously the location is perfect, but other than that my stay was just average at best. front desk agents were not very friendly and valet were too busy on their cell phones/blackberries. room size was surprisingly large. at night the train was very loud, which i realize was beyond the hotel's control, but also impacted my stay.

Reviews.Title: “sweet trip”
Reviews.Author: lovelynurse
Reviews.Content: just got back from san diego ,we spent 2 wonderful nights at Hiltpn Gaslamp,we had a wonderfultime there,only thing that we did complain was air conditioner wasn't working on saturday night but after we told sombody at front desk when we got back from our trip it has been fixed already :) good area and walk distance....

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing stay with great service”
Reviews.Author: Bryley522
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a long weekend for a friend's wedding and stayed here. Overall, we had a very positive experience and would stay here again and recommend the hotel to others. We were happy with the room, although the bathroom was just OK. Negatives: no fridge in the room (where do I put my leftovers?), cost of valet parking ($28/day? ouch!), and the trolley tracks right by the window (if you're a light sleeper) Positives: nice room with a super comfy bed, really excellent service by staff, a lovely fire pit outside, internet included in the room (wired, not wifi), close to a trolley stop We enjoyed our stay and had a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: AllThoseThingsILove
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego fir the BlogHer 2011 conference, and since I procrastinated, I was not able to book the Marriott (the official hotel) Instead I stayed at the Hilton Gaslamp, The property is right across the street from the middle of the convention center. You can;t cross the street in front of the hotel, though. Instead you have to walk about half a block to the crosswalk. Not a big deal, but in my dreams there would be an overhead pedestrian bridge. The are is lovely with many nice restaurants and shops. Out of my window on the 2ns floor (Room 227) I could see the convention center, a dog park, and Flemings. yes, there were earplugs on the bedside table, but I never had to use them. Train/trolley came by but with the window closed I couldnt hear it. The staff was very polite, especially the bellman Berkeley. The valet was always quick to bring my car around, but the daily parking fee ($32? or $36? - I've blocked it from my memory) really put a dent in my budget. The room was open and airy, and the bed very comfortable. I appreciated the free wired internet (but would have loved wireless). The bathroom was well stocked with nice towels and toiletries. The room was very clean overall. A very pleasant stay in a beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: jls74
Reviews.Content: I was there for a business meeting, so some of this information may not be applicable to the typical leisure traveler. The hotel has two buildings; the main building and the annex. I was in the annex. Upon entry into my room, I was greeted by earplugs on the bedside table. There is a train that goes past the hotel at night and it is loud! I did not love having to be in the annex, but I suppose that was not the fault of the hotel. So if you stay there, request the main building. We had two days worth of business meetings in the hotel and we were forced to order food as part of our package. The food was terrible, and the beverages (cans of cokes, etc.) were $4/per can! There was also no wifi in the rooms (!!!) and it was freezing. All of this is not acceptable to me. The location of the hotel is a plus. If you're a tourist, I recommend it for the location. Not for business.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Comic-Con (Or anything held at the Convention Centre)!”
Reviews.Author: butterf1y
Reviews.Content: July 22-24, 2011 Location: We stayed here for our first Comic-Con. Super convenient. Walking distance to the Convention Centre (right across from the hotel). Also very close to all the restaurants, clubs and shopping. And a less than 10 mins ride from the airport! Check In: We arrived a little before check in and was told our room wasn't ready, and they took in our lugguage until our room was ready (we headed over to Comic-Con). We came back shortly after check-in time and our room still wasn't ready. The front desk (before we were able to say anything) gave us a voucher for $20 each and told us to enjoy a drink at the New Leaf restaurant located in the lobby. AND, whatever we don't use, will be credited to our final bill. That's phenomenal customer service. We received a call around 6ish that our room was ready so we checked in. The room: We had a king bed non-smoking room. This room was huge! Came fully appointed with coffee, tea, free internet, flat panel tv, phone, alarm clock, shampoo, conditioner, lotion and soap. There also was a desk, in-room safe and lounge chair. The bed was very comfortable. Food: We didn't order any room service, however did eat at the New Leaf restaurant in the lobby a couple times. Service was very good, and the food was good too. The little things: Since the train is located very close to the hotel, they had ear plugs (for free) incase the "urban" sounds were a distraction. The front desk was always friendly. The bell hop who helped us load our rental car. My other half picked up a bunch of collector items at Comic-Con and the guy(forgot his name) safely and respectfully helped us load the car with our lugguage and Comic-Con items. Last minute late checkout: we barely got any rest during Comic-con and needed a later check out which they gave us without hesitation or extra charge. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great restaurant, great, great great.”
Reviews.Author: ColleenBoston
Reviews.Content: The location of this lovely hotel puts it right over the top. It's 2 blocks from Petco Park, and right across from fun touristy shopping and SD sights. Excellent breakfast buffet on Sunday. We had a baby with us and the crib was all ready and made up, very nice. Clean, friendly, quiet, all good!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Glawen_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small, but it is very well located at the beginning at the Gaslamp and just in front of the Convention Center. It is smaller than the Hilton Bayfront but better located, less crowdy, and staff and service is much better. Breakfast was included, and it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with no service and trains blowing horns”
Reviews.Author: kpim
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel. That's about it. The room us ok. But the trains run right next to the hotel all night blowing it's horn. When we checked in they didn't have any doubles so we politely asked for a roll away bed. We called 3 times since the first request and 3 hours later we still didn't have it. Honestly, we pay so much, how hard is it to get a roll away bed when you couldn't accommodate our request for doubles. If I were paying less than $150 per night, this would not be a problem but it's not the case.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In the Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: PaigeIam
Reviews.Content: Hilton Gaslamp is the only place I will stay when I'm in San Diego. Their staff, lobby and food makes me feel right at home! My favorite detail about this hotel is when I come back to the room there are earplugs waiting for me on the nightstand. I ordered breakfast for the next morning and asked for it to be there around 6:30 and it was delivered right on the dot :) and the server was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the staff,but enjoy the hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ape22
Reviews.Content: very nice rooms especially the loft on 5th street ,amzing jacuzzi rooms ,in the true heart of the gas lamp district dont bother renting a car everything is right there ,and if not you can take a tour bus and hop on and of all day wherever you want to go in san diego for 20 dollars .the only negative is front desk staff is slow and non cooperative at times.no parking valet is 35 a day but you really dont need a car here.beware of ordering any kind of steaks from room service there is a donovans steak house across the street .plenty of restaurants of all price ranges in area avoid room service .grocery store also acroos the street.

Reviews.Title: “Thouroughly Enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: makubre
Reviews.Content: I decided at the last minute to stay at a hotel closer to the airport since I had an early flight and I had been staying 40 minutes away, I am so happy with my choice. I was pleased with the whole stay from check-in to check-out. The room was clean (with the exception of a dirty glass that was supposed to be clean) and comfortable and even though there was lots of revelry going on in the streets from the end of Comic Con the room was pretty quiet. The room service staff was friendly and courteous and they were prompt with my breakfast. It was relaxing and a good choice to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hilton, The Best Location, especially for convention-goers”
Reviews.Author: drustrange
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gaslamp for a week while attending a conference at the convention center. I'm in the Hilton Honors program and frequently stay at Hilton, Hilton Garden Inn, Homewood and the like, and I can say without reservation that the Gaslamp was the best Hilton I've ever stayed at. Reasons: - The front desk staff was friendly, helpful, and just generally professionally awesome. - Hotel lobby and public areas have been recently renovated and is very clean and well furnished with simple, fresh/modern stuff. - The room and its furnishings, decor, and amenities are in great condition. - Bed / mattress was very comfortable, no potholes. Linens were crisp and new and weren't 50%+ polyester. - My room had a sliding glass door out to a tiny balcony, which I recommend as the clean sea breeze was very nice. I think this might be an upgrade, but if it's just $10 - $20 a night, it's worth it. - Room service food was a cut above average Hilton fare. Pricey, but if you chose the healthy options, very tasty and well prepared. They always got every order right and delivered it in under 30 mins. - It was a two minute walk across the railroad tracks to the convention center. Couldn't be easier, conventioneers! - Plus, if you're at the conference and need to have a meeting but don't have space, you can walk back to the hotel restaurant "New Leaf" and meet there, and wine and dine your prey. Food is good here, too. - Right around the corner is the best restaurant district in downtown San Diego. You have dozens of great choices of all types of food and classes of service, and the places are lively and fun to spend time at in the evenings. You can also walk to the movie theater in just a few blocks, and there was lots of good shopping options for those who like that sort of thing. This downtown area vibes as super safe, vibrant, and economically healthy. - It was very easy to get a cab right outside the hotel, even during the convention. A few nits: - When I got to the room there was no mini-fridge. When I called they brought one up right away, but instead of putting it into the furniture that was intended to house it, they stuck it on the floor next to the TV. It worked fine but didn't exactly complement the decor. It was kinda noisy, too. - There is no wifi in the hotel - you have to use the cable at the desk. And it's only 3 feet long. So if you're working all day or want to surf at night, you can't do it on the bed unless you call and ask for a longer cable, which I did. The maintenance guy who brought did so quickly but was surly in the extreme, and it was 40 feet long. Bring your own. - Some folks will be bothered by the horn on the Amtrak train that runs alongside the hotel. You know who you are: you should probably stay elsewhere.
