Overall, I'm giving a super strong recommendation for this hotel, especially for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: hockeyduck30
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Gaslamp was the perfect hotel for my week long stay in San Diego. I was attending a conference for the week across the street at the Convention Center and could leave my hotel less than five minutes before I needed to arrive at the conference. It was a fantastic location and the amenities and room were fantastic! The staff were very helpful and courteous throughout my stay to make sure I was pleased with my visit. A must for anyone attending a conference at the Convention Center!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Trip”
Reviews.Author: moruiz
Reviews.Content: My parents and I just returned from staying at the Hilton and it was a fantastic experience. The staff were excellent from the moment we checked in and out. Yes the fee might seem high for the valet, but the piece of mind of knowing my vehicle was safe was well worth it. Plus being so close to the Gas Lamp Quarter, there was no need to worry about having to commute anywhere else. The ladies at the front desk were very helpful with anything I needed from them. The loft I stayed in was very comfortable with some exceptional beds. I fell asleep immediately after laying down. Spacious lofts. I would highly recommend this hotel to any of my friends and family during future stays. Will be returning there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel to convention center.”
Reviews.Author: cbl7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located across the main entrance of the conv. ctr. Cannot more convenient than that. Overall a good hotel. I stayed there during a conference I was attending. Breakfast was provided due to our co being a hilton honors gold member. Good breakfast, but not really worth the money if you have to pay for it. Rooms were acceptable and clean. As for the noise from the train many prior reviewers have complained about, it all depends on the individual and if you are a light sleeper. It did not bother me at all and I did not use the ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: JTP7
Reviews.Content: For a business stay, this was an excellent choice. David at the front desk welcomed me by name and ensured that he could provide me the best room available. Although he promised to move me to a better room when it became available, the room he put me in was a very nice size room, so I did not request a room change. As a Hilton Diamond, I was given free breakfast and free internet access, The wired internet was pretty fast. Choice of restaurants was abundant around the hotel. All in all, it was a nice stay. Oh by the way, if you are light sleeper, use the ear plugs they provide. For me, it was not a problem as I slept through the noises/horns of the trains. Thank you, Hilton for a very nice stay. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Trains are loud!”
Reviews.Author: ADAtrip_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice but had a hard time sleeping at night because of the loud trains at 3 AM. Made it difficult to enjoy trip since sleep deprived. Tried the earplugs that were on nightstand but didn't work. Suggest a hotel that isn't next to tracks. No wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Service? What service?”
Reviews.Author: Fuzzyguy
Reviews.Content: Good location, decent rooms, all the basics are more or less in place. Don't forget to bring an international adaptor - if you are the occassional tourist from overseas - as the hotel does not provide them. It's pretty much a self-help hotel. Pity, it could be much better. Parking is only valet at 38 USD/day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: golfnsailAZ
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Hilton Gaslamp Quarter. The staff was great! The gentleman who checked us in couldn't have been more helpful and gave us great restaurant recommendations (for fish tacos try the Tin Fish across from the Padres ballpark). The room was large and very well appointed. Very clean. And finally the location was great. Walking distance to all the action and quick access to the freeways for beaches (I recommend Coronado Beach).

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT LEAVE YOUR LUGGAGE WITH THE BELL HOP AT THIS HILTON HOTEL IN THE GAS LAMP DISTRICT OF SAN DIEGO! THEY STOLE MY L”
Reviews.Author: monicaNewportBeach
Reviews.Content: Do Not Leave Your Luggae With The Bell Hop AT This Hilton Hotel IN The Gas Lamp District Of San Diego! They Stole My Loius Vitton Briefcase With All My Belongs In It! There Is No Security And Their "Front Desk" Mgr Jennifer [---] Was Of No Help Or Comfort!. It Was An Inside Job. Had to call The police to file a report!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for clubbing”
Reviews.Author: TJSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice and I am going to stay there again at the end of this week. I love the location. It is so close to the eateries and bars of the Gaslamp and it is a short walk to Petco Park. I must have lucked out on my stays because I didn't hear the trains although I have heard them before while staying in nearby hotels. For the record, it is a freight train that makes all of the noise. The end of the line for the Amtak and Coaster trains is North of this hotel and the S.D. Trolley is pretty quiet. Anyway if you want to be stumble distance from your favorite party spot, this is the hotel for you. I recomend ordering the french toast from room service to help you get over your hangover.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep, trains go by in the middle of the night!”
Reviews.Author: yanka7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night on the business trip. The location seemed good during the day, walking distance to the convention center and restaurants of the Gaslamp Quarter. However, the earplugs on the night stand should have been a clue! There were at least 3 trains passing by the hotel at the middle of the night, with "horn" signals (it was unreal, like from the movie!) I am not sure if there are rooms at this hotel that have windows facing the other side, where train noise is not so bad, but if you see earplugs on the night stand - you will not have a restful sleep.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stay for a baseball game”
Reviews.Author: JPTexan82
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Apr the 23rd for one night. I booked the room on Hotwire for $93.00. The room was a good size with a flat screen T.V. The bathroom is ok for size, the shower needs to be rechalked or grouuted becuse it is stained and not cleaned very well. I asked for a room on the back side of the hotel away from the train tracks and also asked for a box fan and I did not hear any noise from the street or the trains if there was any. The beds are very nice we had a king size. As for parking I found free on the street parking about a block away which was fine for one night. I was not about to pay for $35.00 to park a rental car that I only paid $18 to rent. I called the front desk and told them I wanted to stay there two more night and to ask if they could discount the parking, the said " they could not". So I checked out after one night which was fine for me. Ballpark is close, zoo is close and there is a Ralphs grocery store 5 blocks inland.

Reviews.Title: “Personal items taken during stay”
Reviews.Author: Jwalto3
Reviews.Content: This hotels in a great area, and served it's purpose. However, an IPod touch and nano were taken from our room the last day we were there. We left them unattended once all week. It was our fault for being too trusting of the staff, and we have definitely learned our lesson. Keep a close eye on your belongings- especially the ones hidden in your suitcase. Additionally, sleeping throughout the whole night was difficult due to the train. They give you ear plugs, that somewhat help. If you can't sleep with ear plugs, I would advise staying further from the tracts. Lastly, the chairs at the swimming pool lay flat, and do not recline up and down. I don't know about you, but I like to read, drink, and socialize at the pool, and it was very uncomfortable doing all of the above laying flat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: theobjetive
Reviews.Content: I stay for two days, the hotel is not very big, it is located in a great zone, if you like to walk this district is the place to be. I didn’t like to pay 35 dlls for valet parking but I had to in order to park my car. It is near Petco Baseball Park, about three or four blocks away. The room I got was very quite, I didin't noticed the train outside, if there was any passing by. If I have the chance, I will be back to this hotel. The disadvantages are the valet parking and the absence of free wireless internet. Also, the food is not that great, do not order room service, there are a bunch of good restaurants outside

Reviews.Title: “Good location for downtown San Diego...lousy place to get a good night's rest.”
Reviews.Author: buckrogers3
Reviews.Content: I asked twice by telephone and during check-in for a quiet room. As a Hilton Diamond member, we were "upgraded" to one of the loft-type rooms in the adjoining building. The room was spacious and satisfactory. The carpet was well-worn and the bathroom mirror was cracked. The buffet breakfast was mediocre and somewhat substandard for a Hilton hotel. The really unsatisfactory part of our three-night stay was the noise heard around the clock from the commuter train that runs between the hotel and the convention center. We were awaken nightly from the train whisles in spite of the warning sign and ear plugs left at our bed-side stand. The hotel is in a good location for the gas-lamp district, but we will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for convention center attendees”
Reviews.Author: jina_7
Reviews.Content: Positives: location, fast room service, comfortable bed, soft sheets, friendly employees Negatives: no minibar in room, wimpy shower pressure, poor selection of channels on tv, no wifi

Reviews.Title: “What was said u get on the website u don't.”
Reviews.Author: twobadfoeyou9157
Reviews.Content: Please read this my stay here was horrible when we got here we where told that we would have a fridge a fold out couch a wet bar and didn't get none of that then our room had cups under the couch from other guest and u would think after complaining we would get an upgrade but no got their cheapest bottle of wine. And they also charged the card 200 more thank u for reading

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and services, good for business or personal stay”
Reviews.Author: BusyST
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for eight nights and it was a comfortable stay. I booked a loft room which was spacious and also over looked the courtyard. The only downside was it was quite noisy at times. The rooms are clean and tidy and in good decorative order. It has a fab pool and good spa on sight however the parking is quite costly at $34 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: OliviaMG
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to San Diego- we chose to stay at the Hilton. We stayed in "The Loft" side of the hotel- kind of a jot from the front desk. We had a view of the Coronado Bridge, the front enterance to the Gaslamp District, Hard Rock Hotel. Most believe the street noise to be extremely loud- I didn't find it to be so. You are able to hear some noise but I found it to be typical big city sounds. Nothing that kept me up at night. Once we entered our room the cleaning staff came by to make sure we had everything. Very thoughtful. Cleam room. Bathroom needed to be updated. The weather was chilly and rainy most of the weekend- we had to call the front desk to fix our heater- as the thermostat didn't work properly. We had left our room to to sight-see- came back found a space heater on the floor. Kind of disappointing and not safe. Found our hotel to be w/n walking distance of the Midway (on the Harbor), Little Italy, Gaslamp (of course). Took a cab to Balboa Park- beautiful. Went for a sail boat ride on Sail San Diego. Totally worth the money. The sail boat holds 10 people, snacks, alcohol and other beverages provided, blankets, jackets available if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: artiekay1227
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day business stay at this hotel. Great Gaslamp Quarter location, right across from the convention center. Grocery/deli across the street was a plus. Comfortable and clean rooms Small refrigerator and free reliable wired internet in room (Hope you get wireless soon!). Happy hour with free hors d'oeuvres Mon-Friday. Friendly, helpful concierge and front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Close, Convenient & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Paco1paco
Reviews.Content: Good hotel right at the entrance to the Gaslamp district and very close to the convention center. Hotel was roomy, friendly and all around reflective of a typical business hotel. Location was very close to the train tracks so had problems sleeping with the nose from the constant horn blasts at all hours of the night. Overall very good experience for those looking for a standard business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull stay”
Reviews.Author: Fel1x
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through Hotwire for around 100.00 dollars. Wonderfull stay, quiet, comfortable beds ( equivalent to four seasons), wonderfull pool, patio and gym. Valet parking was 35.00 ( average in town). Close to shops and running trail.

Reviews.Title: “Good, especially if you're in town for a conventions/conference”
Reviews.Author: omeeda
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a conference at he convention center. Location excellent as it is right across the street from the convention center. It is also in the gaslamp district, which is full of bars and restaurants. I was given free breakfast vouchers, which came in handy. There was an omelet station which I hit up everyday. There were also the usual offering at hotel breakfast spreads (scrambled egg, sausage, fruit, cereal, beads, etc...) The only drawback as people here have mentioned is its location across the street from the train tracks. At night, freight trains roll on by, with the conductors blasting their horns, which will wake you up from sleep. I thought it was kind of annoying, but itself wouldn't prevent me from staying here again. I would probably just ask for a room not facing the train tracks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Espunoza
Reviews.Content: Next to the best in San Diego. If you are in a convention, its perfect. Rooms are clean, everything you need you get.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice stay - super pain check out”
Reviews.Author: MarvinMeister
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is a beautiful hotel located in the trendy gaslamp district of San Diego. The room was large and included a large flat screen tv, reading chair with ottoman, large window, and average sized bathroom. We chose a room with a king size bed as well as a rollaway and there was still plenty of room to move around. Restaurant selections within walking distance was outstanding ranging from $ to $$$. Our only issue occured at checkout. When we checked in we told the desk clerk we needed to split the room three ways. He assured us it was no problem and would be taken care of at checkout. However, upon checkout we were told that needed to be done at check in but the "clerk was too lazy to do the extra work required." This was annoying and delayed our departure to the airport by thirty minutes. I would recommend staying here, but if you have any special payment arrangements make sure you get them taken care of at check in!

Reviews.Title: “Get ready to Party...”
Reviews.Author: withliberty
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with young children and we had a great stay, but this place is meant for people who want a hip, trendy place to stay and want to be close to the action. The location cannot be beat. It is directly across the street from the Convention Center and directly at the entrance of the Gaslamp District; an easy walk to Petco Park and next to the Hard Rock Hotel. This area is party central. First tip: skip the valet parking that is offered for $30+ per night. We parked in a garage at G Street that charges $3 per night on weeknights; $9 per night on weekend nights, plus $1 per hour after 3:00am. Total tab each day was usually $10 for us. Second tip: Weekday happy hour is a great warm up for the night. Excellent complimentary buffet and happy hour drink specials. Children were welcomed in the bar area, but there is also plenty of adjacent lounge space where you can take your food and beverage. This is important because there is often a long wait for dinner at any number of the area restaurants. Third tip: Understand that you are staying in a downtown, urban location with people who want to be in a downtown, urban location. You will hear noise from the railroad tracks and you will know if the people in the room next to you are having an argument. In our case, the people next door were incredibly intoxicated, loud and unruly. They were quickly ejected by the hotel staff (who also comped us for the night because our room was next door). The next morning, I saw housekeeping cleared two empty 32 oz. bottles of Jack Daniels from their room (to give you an indicator). I don't complain about much, but this complaint justified and was ably handled. Next - there is a laundromat about 5 blocks up the street. There were two college basketball team managers doing their laundry there in the morning, so I felt it was a safe, comfortable choice - although obviously there were many "lower caste" users in the area. Many would disagree with me here, but with airlines charging $50 RT to bring anything more than carryon, I thought $6 for doing my laundry was a better value on a two-week trip. Finally, the staff are hit or miss. The hotel has excellent, 5-star quality staff and apathetic, 1-star quality staff. They are pretty easy to tell by their smile (or lack of). Hint: Guests do not exist to provide staff with tips; staff is there to provide guests with excellent service - at which point those who are 5-star will receive generous tips... I have a couple of quick notes after reading previous reviews. First, everything in the downtown area is relatively close and is easily walkable. There is a Hilton Bayfront that is right around the corner for those looking for a more quiet experience and want to stay in the Hilton family and also a Doubletree nearby. That said, all the hotels in this district are within 8 blocks of each other, so there's no reason to pay much more for any one hotel compared to another. Also, be prepared to see homeless people on every block in this area. They are part of the scenery, but not often in your face.

Reviews.Title: “When they hand you in the ear plug upon check in, you know you are not in the right place...”
Reviews.Author: lmaolol
Reviews.Content: very loud... do not expect to be able to sleep well regardless of where they put you up - main building has the incredibly loud train running right in front of it, the supposed "suites" in the back are somewhat larger than the other rooms, however, they are facing the Hard Rock, where parties and incredibly loud music runs till 2 a.m. The water in the pool is ice cold. The food is... I wouldn't recommend it. It is convenient for being Down Town, nothing else beyond that.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hilton”
Reviews.Author: xjohnnie3x
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night and really enjoyed our experience at the hilton. the location is great. right next to gaslamp. the staff was also great. the room was nice and comfortable. i would definitely recomment the hilton to anyone looking to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location (Except for the Trains)”
Reviews.Author: RandB-South-Staffs
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, stay here regularly. Amenities are good, location is great - right opposite the Convention Centre and on the entrance to the Gaslamp quater (which is full of shopping, bars, clubs and restaurants etc). Any its only a short walk to Sea port village and the maritime museum. Rooms and hotel are good, staff too. Only bad things I can say to be honest are the trains coming by all through the night keep you awake and the bar doens't serve draft beer (Doh!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Room - LOUD EXTERIOR NOISES”
Reviews.Author: actravelerMichigan
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice and updated. However, I can hear the trains every night, especially at 4am. I can deal with that. However, the hotel scheduled a party on their outdoor patio with loud music and people drinking and shouting well into the night. This was SO frustrating. I called the desk to ask how long the party was scheduled and was told the hotel was near capacity and I could request a move if I needed to. Well, the party is so loud, I am pretty sure it can be heard from everywhere in the hotel. Other than this, it is a nice place. Just rude when it comes to scheduling a party that affects all the rooms facing the outdoor patio.

Reviews.Title: “Near train tracks- not as nice as area hotels”
Reviews.Author: GRGirl99
Reviews.Content: Just checked in here as I had to stay an extra day on business and the Marrriott Marina was booked. I travel a lot, but this was below typical Hiltons. Long wait at front desk. Stains on the curtains. Still waiting for room service. They provide ear plugs on the night stands because the "train conductor sometimes gets out of hand." I'd stay down the road that the Hyatt or Marriott Marina, which are much nicer. I stayed at the MM and it was clean, efficient staff, and well organized.

Reviews.Title: “Parking here is a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: joemadariaga
Reviews.Content: The location and the room were amazing, no trolley noise, and amazing spots because it is in teh heart of Gaslamp Quarter. We chose this hotel because of downtown and major freeways convenience, and also of the nearby shopping and dinnering spots. The bussiness center is a robbery; they stole me $7.60 for printing 3 pages (0.99 each) and 5 minutes of internet (0.69 each), i was stunned with. And no way to avoid the parking quota of $35 per night!!! They should offer a reasonable parking rates for guests.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location for congress, even with city noises...”
Reviews.Author: Monpetit
Reviews.Content: 4 nights during a congress and so just 100 yards to walk... Clean and large room and by chance far from elevators and vending machines... Bathroom is well equiped, coffee makers with tea, regular and decaff. Free access to internet in rooms andwifi in lobby. Breakfast is average(scrambled eggs are not scramble eggs, as almost everywhere...). pastries are good, coffee not so bad for an european. Some nights, railways corn....but the hotel give some earplugs... Erik

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Great service and location.”
Reviews.Author: LexKYtraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here on an overnight business trip. TYhe hotel is in a great location for all tourist activities. There is a running,walking trail and metro station right next to the hotel. The thing that stands out about this hotel was the service. The people were all great. Kelly at the front desk was awesome! My only complaints were the rooms are dated. The furnishings showed signs of wear and needed updated. My room had an 80's feel to it. The bed was quite comfortable. My other complaint was the free food served during happy hour in the bar. The finger foods were disgusting. Not sure what to call them...they were truely disgusting! I know that business travelers would appreciate a upgrade to the happy hour food offerings! Overall the hotel is acceptable, I would stay there again but they could help their rating in TA by updating their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: MS32
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to win this hotel for a reasonable rate on Hotwire. When I arrived after a 5-hour drive from Phoenix I as so relieved to find this is a beautiful, smaller scale hotel in a fantastic location, right across from the convention center and in the heart of the Gaslamp District. I was greeted on every turn with incredibly friendly and helpful service from the valet to the registration desk. My request for a higher floor room was kindly accomodated with an awesome corner room with views of the water on one side and city lights on other side. What else can I say? Great free apps and drink specials at happy hour, gorgeous clean pool, very quiet rooms, fantastic service...and did I mention the awesome location? I will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: Parisianna
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hilton san diego from the gaslamp quarter for 4 nights with my family. The hotel's location, in downtown san diego was greatly appreciated and very convenient since most amenities were within a reasonable walking distance of the hotel. But, remember it is a city hotel, so don't expect to meet california surfers and such in the neighborhood. Many restaurants and bars only a few minutes away from the hotel. You will find restaurants for all budgets, and YES, it is possible to eat great food in the US :) as long as you can pay for it ! The hotel being downtown San Diego, you can easily walk up the main street and catch the trolley that will get you anywhere near the places of interest. I strongly recommand you use public transportation and walking, you would miss so much of this beautiful area by renting a car ! The hotel staff was also very friendly and helpful, when recommanding us places to visit and the breakfast was the best. I am no big eater in the morning but the choice was so wide and yummy, I had to have breakfast. In the end, breakfast was so rich that I didn't have to eat at lunchtime !! Breakfast was the only meal I took at the hotel since I preferred to take advantage of the many restaurants around, for dinner. The outdoor pool was also greatly appreciated, and I just HAD to try it, although I got flu, probably due to cool wind ! What I didn't like, but that is only my personal point of view, I thought the furnishing was a little old fashioned, conservative, I would've liked it better in a modern environment. However, although, I didn't like the decoration too much, premises, bedding and hotel in general were very comfortable. I would recommand it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “This Hilton is a good location”
Reviews.Author: EJK1320
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to the convention center and restuarants. However beware if you are a light sleeper! The train goes by all night - the hotel even provides ear plugs on the night stand. Beds were comfortable. The restuarant service was slow and there was no airport check-in kiosk, something you'd expect from this level hotel. Overall the stay was "fine" just not one of the ones you remember.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, adequate room.”
Reviews.Author: Msallen212
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip in San Diego in August with a few colleagues. The staff was very helpful. We didn't request their assistance too often but when we did they were more than helpful. The room was decent size and the beds are very comfortable. The big TV was also a nice plus. :) The hotel is very close to the Padres stadium so me and my colleagues decided to catch a game one night. The front desk girl actually arranged and purchased the tickets for us which was surprisingly courteous. I am very satisfied with the staff and hotel in general. I will definitely be a returning guest.

Reviews.Title: “bad service”
Reviews.Author: frau
Reviews.Content: We are 3 ladies staying at this hotel,arrived today 9/27,here til Friday,room was reserved for 3 persons,there are pillows and towels for 2 and no shower caps or other ammenites,we have called the front desk 3 times and made a trip to the desk on ou way out to shop,our room has a view of another room,beware there must be a reason this hotel is rated #52 in San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , overall a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: golden190
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here over Labor Day weekend. I got a great deal on Expedia. Comfy beds and pillows! I wish I remembered her name but the girl in the cocktail was excellent. It was great that across the street there was a little store that had liqour and had great breakfast sandwhiches. At the advice of others on TA i asked for a room away from the train and that's what I was given. A couple of little things. No mini bar in the rooms....not that big of a deal. Parking is $35 a night but you really don't need a car unless you venture outside of the area. It would have been nice if breakfast was included but I can't complain since I got such a great deal on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond...”
Reviews.Author: Colleen126126
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton after getting a great rate on Priceline. We asked our customer service rep. Tiffanie, if she could upgrade us. She accommodated our request, and upgraded us to the king suite with a jacuzzi tub. We were not very impressed with the room (it looked like a Mr. Rogers seventies revival attempt gone bad). I promptly called Tiffanie, and she worked her magic and got us in to the loft suite. Although we assumed "loft," meant two stories, it was only one. However, the accommodations were beautiful. Very modern decor, and a full balconly, viewing the pool. Tiffanie was so nice and really helped us have a romantic get away. She went above and beyond our expectations and was patient and friendly throughout- despite my 15 calls to her within the first 23 minutes of arriving...We will definitely be returning to this establishment in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Justaguy061
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 days in august during a business trip. Although a bit high in price, it is in the center of the Gas Lamp Quarter, so that is to be expected. The people, from check in, through chamber maids were some of the friendliest I have come across while traveling. They always had a smile, a hello, and asked is there any thing that I can do for you. The rooms were nice, fairly large, clean and comfortable. The location is great, right in the middle of the district, and a few blocks from the base ball stadium. I'd definitely stay there is I ever need to return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel - Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JayTC
Reviews.Content: I spent labor day weekend at this Hilton and it was an absolutely the right choice. Hotel opened in 2000 and it's still well maintain and in a great shape. I got a room on 3rd floor [317] and really recommend this room for anyone. This room has a nice view to the pool and also convention center plus coronado bridge. Lavazza coffee is good. Bathroom products are from CrabTree. Location couldn't be better. - trolley is right there! [orange line] - Petco Staduim is about a block - Gaslamp quarter with ton of shops and restaurants - convention center is right across the street Room was quite small but clean and I like 42" TV (^__^) Front desk and bell boy were very helpful. The room wasn't ready when I got there and the front desk guy even offered to call me and let me know when room is ready. He also gave me a room with sofa bed too! Bell boy also gave me the map and tips to explore San Diego. Pool and fitness room are on 2nd floor. Outdoor pool area was really nice! I was worried at first to have a room facing train tracks for both MTS and Amtrak. Hilton has earplugs ready for guests but I didn't really need to use it. I can hear the train noise on my second night but it wasn't too loud to wake me up anyway. few cons; parking $35/night, no breakfast, free wired internet - wifi only available in lobby area. This is my first visit to San Diego and I really had a good time staying at this hotel. I would recommend Hilton Gaslamp to anyone (business traveler, sport fan, tourist, foodies, bar hopper etc. ) for it's location, room quality and everything else : )

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable option for Convention Attendees”
Reviews.Author: kyoto5301
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this Hilton for a meeting. It is right across the street from the Convention Center which would be very convenient for people who are in town for a convention there. I was on the third floor, away from the tracks. I could still hear the train but it didn't bother me, though it did wake me up twice in the night. The room was large and I enjoyed my little Juliet balcony in the mornings, watching the town wake up. There are many restaurants in walking distance. It is easy to reach the harbor if you cut through the hotel across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but they nickle and dime you after the $200 per nt fee.”
Reviews.Author: sandraestaaqui
Reviews.Content: To me, if your spending that much, and parking garage is below, why still charge $35? That's only complain I have. Other than that, breakfast is not free, but we dound a nice store, min restaurant accross the st that serves breakfast for allot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for convention center - some odd touches!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGal02
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention across the street, and the location of this Hilton couldn't have been more convenient. Having been warned by other Trip Advisor reviews, I requested and got a room away from the railroad tracks and above the noise, and was not bothered at ALL by night sounds. Staff was very pleasant and helpful and the breakfast buffet was great (even had a free breakfast one morning because they were late getting started so they graciously refused to charge me!) The only thing I found a little odd about this hotel, (especially given the healthy price of the room) was the absence of certain amenities in the room - including a shower cap, a safe, drinking glasses in the bathroom, and a refrigerator. On the other hand the room was very spacious and clean, there were no toll charges for 800 numbers, and there was free wi-fi. So..I would say I had no real complaints and enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Christina1983
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Gaslamp while taking the bar exam in San Diego last week. The good: - Location, location, location. The Hilton is literally right across the street from the convention center, and just a few blocks in the other direction are plenty of dining & shopping options. - My room was very nice - well decorated, comfortable bed, good size, and impeccably clean. The bad: - For the price, you don't get a whole lot. The in-room coffee is cheap (and the creamer in my room was sour - apparently it hadn't been changed in a very long time) and the bathroom amenities are nothing special. - This ties into location, but be careful where you book. The hotel is in the Gaslamp quarter, so there is a lot going on outside. I was on the second floor and could hear everything. Not good for a light sleeper. - The air conditioning unit in my room was either broken or not set properly- I had to knock it down to 64 degrees to feel comfortable. - The restaurant is awful. $15 for a personal pizza; $20 for salty eggs and soft fruit in the morning. Unfortunately I was tied in because I had to eat quick and then run to the exam in the morning, but if you have the option, get your food elsewhere. - The fitness center was also pretty bad. They only have two treadmills and one elliptical, and the elliptical is desperately in need of servicing. - Service was so-so. I requested a mini-fridge on my first day there (my plan was to pick up some breakfast food at the local supermarket) and was told they were out, but said one should open up in the next day or so (this was fine with me because I was there for 5 days). I never heard back from anyone on the situation. Similarly, I stopped by the front desk a couple of times to ask for directions or a specific restaurant, and the front desk staff did not seem particularly interested in helping out. Bottom line - for the price you are paying, there are several comparable hotels nearby. The Hilton gave me the feeling that it could be a nice place, but that it just wasn't trying very hard. I would check out the Marriott or Hyatt before booking at the Hilton. (Also, there are several boutique hotels in the Gaslamp quarter not far from the convention center - they looked nice in passing and would be worth a look).

Reviews.Title: “Cannot do better!”
Reviews.Author: Loveload
Reviews.Content: Absolutely FANTASTIC hotel in EVERY WAY!!! Check In: We were greeted by a sweet girl (Kelly) who not only asked her manager (Spencer) if we could get upgraded (it was a slow Monday night) but also sent a complimentary dessert and hand written card to our room as we were celebrating my boyfriend's birthday. Room: Our upgrade was to stay in the Lofts on 5th and the room was absolutely lovely! Very cool vibe on that side of the hotel, but the entire hotel from the lobby to the set up was very cool. Location: For the price & accommodations you absolutely could not do better. Right on the end of the gaslamp quarter and accesible to EVERYTHING. The only downside is the parking fee of $35 per night, but if you are staying downtown, it is expected that you will be paying that much. We go down to San Diego monthly and this will probably end up being our new hotel in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property. Great Location. $35 a Day Parking?!?”
Reviews.Author: DesertExec
Reviews.Content: I always feel a little taken by hotels that offer competitive rooms rates and then stick you with outrageous add-ons like overpriced room service, parking etc. In this well run property, the only add-on of note is the $35 a day parking fee which seems ridiculous. Beyond that, the staff is excellent, the room service menu abundant, creative and well-priced and the breakfast buffet perfect. My room had a little post-convention (ComicCon) mustiness that cleared up after a day with windows open and a scented candle burning. The hotel is well situtated for anything downtown, including the Gaslamp, Horton Plaza ot the Embarcadero and Seaport Village. I walked nightly until my legs ached. There is a small deli right across the street and a World Market 1/2 a block away for more interesting snacks, wines, bottled water etc. I will stay here again as I always enjoy my visit.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Return”
Reviews.Author: thetractorman
Reviews.Content: I've been to San Diego several times for conferences, and my wife has been able to accompany me each time. We've stayed at a different hotel each time, and this is the best combination of value, comfort and location that I've been able to land yet. We stayed 7 nights this year, and have nothing but praise for this hotel. Checkin was quick and courteous, all the staff was very pleasant and helpful, and the room was very comfortable. Our 3rd floor was right above the hotel entrance and the dog park, and it was generally very pleasant with the sliding door open unless someone was smking down below. The trolley and rairoad tracks are very close, but I didn't find the noise to be a problem at all, maybe because I've always liked trains, but also because the louder freight and Coaster trains are only a few times per day. We used the fitness center and pool most evenings. The fitness center is OK for our needs, but doesn't have much in the way of weight training equipment. The pool and hot tub were comfortable and a great place to relax after a cardio workout. We ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant a few times. The buffet is fairly expensive, but I found the quesadilla to be big enough for two to share, and the low-carb omelet is also big enough to share. We didn't eat any other meals at the hotel because there are too many places nearby that we've never tried. We will definitely be back here. In fact, it's already reserved for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - not very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ZBTUsa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a bit of a disappointment to me. It is hugely overpriced and the rooms are very generic and dull. It is in a good location and it has some nice facilities like the pool and fitness centre. But I was staying here for a conference and, although the staff were impeccable, there were some things that I was not so happy with. The conference meal was not good and it was quite expensive! Also the wine served at the conference bar was $10 a glass, while at the normal Hilton bar it was just $6 or £7?! You had to pay to log on to use the interenet in their business centre and to print out documents. The rates for having clothes washed were ridiculous, and the rates for parking were expensive too! The rooms were also quite noisy with trains going past late at night. Overall, I felt that the hotel had some positive things about it, but it was rather disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: CaliCarol
Reviews.Content: Typically, my husband and I stay at the Westin Gaslamp when traveling to San Diego, but after finding a great rate online for the Hilton, we tried it for the first time. What a gem!! GREAT location, friendly staff, and a complimentary upgrade...it was a thoroughly enjoyable night! Traffic noise, referenced in some other reviews, was not an issue. Our room was away from the trolley, so maybe that made the difference. All in all, the staff was amazing, room was beautiful, and location perfect. We'll definitely be back to the Hilton Gaslamp!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: vegetarian-girl
Reviews.Content: my family and i spent thanksgiving week driving along the coast of southern CA and we stayed here for 3 nights. the room was great, the fitness center was nice, the staff were courteous and the price was an exceptional bargain (through priceline).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: soonerpsych
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Gaslamp for the last part of our 3 city honeymoon, following Napa and San Francisco. It is very pretty, and within walking distance of the convention center, trolley, baseball park, and all of the Gaslamp Quarter. You can watch the Sea World fireworks from your hotel room, enjoy the 2nd floor pool/hot tub terrace, or watch the dogs play in the yard in front of the hotel. We stayed over the July 4th holiday weekend, so the hotel was very busy. Room service seemed very mixed up and slow. Otherwise, the whole stay was excellent. The concierge was very helpful and they (like other Hiltons) provide a kiosk to print your airline boarding pass for free. The hotel's downsides: poor public transportation access to the airport (you need to take a cab), expensive internet and business center, noisy train and frequent sirens nearby. Do notice what you're getting from the concierge though: we got zoo tickets thinking we were getting a discount, which we were, but from the full pass not the regular admission ticket. But take his restaurant and bar suggestions, he was spot on!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, noisy trains!”
Reviews.Author: Libs1414
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location. Walking distance to everything. Our first night, which I believe was a Thursday night we were awaken by trains at least five times. They were very loud and blowing their horns. The other nights of our stay were much quieter and we were able to get more sleep. Good service and comfortable rooms. The only things I would change are the timers on the bathroom lights, you can't turn them off yourself. We were on a trip for leisure but I think this would be a great hotel for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel at the base of the Gaslamp Quarter”
Reviews.Author: CouncilmanK
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights as part of a conference across the street at the Marriott. Location is key to the benefit of the Hilton Gaslamp - restaurants and bars of 5th Street very convenient to the hotel. Petco Park a three block walk if you are in for a Padres game - buses to Coronado not far, and the light rail line stops just steps from the hotel. Was aware of the train noise issue, but I asked for a room on the other side of the hotel and was accommodated. Beds were Hilton quality, and the bathroom standard. Nice size TVs and very nice (albeit small) Fitness Center that has direct access to a lovely pool/hot tub deck. Wired access included in room rate. Room rates (189, 209) were to be expected for this area of town, but would look to stay here again on business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, got good rest despite the train route below :)”
Reviews.Author: ashtop
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a conference at the convention center and that is right opposite the Hilton. Gaslamp Quarter is a great place - eat outs, nightlife. Rooms and service at the hotel was Hilton-grade. I had a great view from my room of the bay. There is a railroad passing right next to the hotel. So you get to hear the gates ringing every time a train passes by. But I would still recommend the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Loud Train”
Reviews.Author: FasTxn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend get away. You couldn't ask for a better location. Restaurants, ballpark, shopping, clubs, waterfront, and yes, THE TRAIN. Wow, I guess if you see a pair of ear plugs on your night stand and a note explaining why you might need them,(train) YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED. It was 3:30 am Saturday morning when it started blowing. Other than that, everything was great. And since we had been warned, we just laughed and tried to go back to sleep. $32 a night to park seemed high, but welcome to the Gaslamp Quarter of San Diego!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, more soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: Marcia7575
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to attend some baseball games at nearby Petco Park. The location was fabulous, with plenty of restaurants, and places to stroll. The room was comfortable, large and clean. However, the train runs right next to the location and the drivers seem to delight in blowing their whistle in the middle of the night. If you can get a room at the opposite end of the hotel (facing K Street) it would probably be better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a cracking location”
Reviews.Author: JanetteP1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week on a recent vacation - the entire package including flights was £700 (approx $1000) so I reckon I must've got a very good deal on the hotel. Checkin was swift and I was given my choice of type of room - I took the King. The room was on the 1st floor (2nd US) and faced directly onto the railroad tracks, so I was a little concerned on the noise front. I needn't have been. I only got woken once by the train in the entire week despite being a light sleeper. Just turned over and went back to sleep. Didn't even need to use the ear plugs provided. The location is excellent. Only 2 blocks from Petco Park, and the trolley was even closer than that. Plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance which is nice if you fancy a drink but don't want to get behind the wheel afterwards. The room was well kitted out with the exception of a fridge. Would've been nice to have one but it isn't the end of the world. Nice desk area with ergo chair, and a separate chair and footstool to sit on if you wanted a more relaxed stance. Bathroom was fine, and I loved the Crabtree & Evelyn bath products provided. The gym was small but fairly well equipped with 2 treadmills, a cross trainer, and a reclined bike. There were a couple of weights machines, free weights, mats etc too. I used it every day and was perfectly happy with it. The pool area was closed the first couple of days, but opened again on Memorial Day weekend - the pool is quite small, but clean, The surrounding area has plenty of loungers and a nice decked area. Staff were lovely, especially the cleaning crew who always left my room looking immaculate. I'll definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ItsmeDanielle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Gaslamp San Diego with a friend of mine for my 27th birthday weekend. I had booked it through a third party website, not knowing what type of room I would end up with. When I called to request a room with two beds, I was told unfortunately that none were available, but since it was my birthday, they would upgrade me to a Deluxe King corner room with a pull out sofa. I thought that was really nice of them, and the room turned out to be wonderful. Spacious and clean, with a great view. The location of the hotel is perfect. Walking distance to shops, restaurants and bars. The concierge was also very helpful in recommending local restaurants for my birthday dinner. I would definitely recommend this hotel to someone looking for a great place to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: scadventurer12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed staying here. The room was well-decorated and clean. The check-in process was simple. The friendly front desk worker even let us have our room two hours early with no questions asked. We did have to pay the $35 to valet, but it was well worth it to us. We did get a deal on Priceline for this hotel, so the extra fee to park didn't bother us. The location is great. We went out for dinner in Old Town, but had drinks in the Gaslamp. There was a game at Petco Park, so it was busy down there. We enjoyed being able to walk around and get back to our hotel with no problem. They did have ear plugs for the train, but we didn't need them. We didn't hear the train. Guess the train conductor took a night off? Or we were just sleeping so well on the comfy beds we didn't hear it? Either way, it wasn't an issue for us. Bottom line, it met our criteria: clean, safe and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hesitate to come back.”
Reviews.Author: STRCanada
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gaslamp Hilton for 4 nights recently while I attended a convention. We stayed in a loft room and found it very comfortable. We had a spacious, clean, corner room with high ceilings and large windows on two walls. Everything felt clean and decor is modern but warm. Pool area has a nice large deck with great lounging/tanning beds although the pool is quite small. Hot tub was great in the evenings. Noise was not an issue for us. We were facing away from the train tracks and were never awoken by a train or street noise, even though we were there over a weekend while the Padres were playing 2 blocks away. The streets were active in the evening but not enough to prevent a great sleep. I guess if you are a light sleeper it could be a problem but they do provide ear plugs. Location is fabulous for the convention centre and there is street access to the terrace so you don't have to go through the lobby to get to your room. There are so many restaurants in the area - no lack of choice. The price was the best I could find of the nicer hotels near the convention centre. We didn't have a car so weren't affected by the $30 parking fee but I think it's the same at all the downtown hotels. No problem recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for convention center”
Reviews.Author: Ohio2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the Hilton. I was attending meetings at the convention center and could not have picked a better location. It was a 3 minute walk to the convention center and the entire Gaslamp area was safe & friendly. I ate most of my meals within a 2-3 block radius of the hotel. I was entertaining customers and ate at some very nice 5 star restaurants. I had read some poor reviews on TripAdvisor about the hotel, but that was not my experience. The price was on the high side, but comparable to the other hotels in the area. The service & quality of the staff was excellent, although I did have a small issue getting lunch service one day. The train did make a lot of noise, but it goes by the other hotels in the area also. It did not keep me from sleeping or enjoying the hotel. I arrived very early and a room was available for early check-in. All in all, if you are visiting the convention center you could not pick a better location. I also visited the US Midway for a tour, about a 20 minute walk from the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Great!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Lady_2004
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Lindberg airport, took a taxi to hotel. Taxi cost about $12-$15 depending on taxi. Supper Shuttle is $8.00. Hotel is about 10 to15 minutes from airport. Hilton Gaslamp is located at the entrance to the Historical Gaslamp District. Check in went smooth, staff friendly. Hotel is like a boutique hotel with 12 floors. Rooms have been re done, (bed comfortable) as the Hilton Gaslamp was built in 2000.There is Spa attached to the hotel called Artisan, hotel has a small swimming pool, fitness room. An upscale restaurant is right next to the Hotel. There is a nice outdoor sitting area across from the entrance to the hotel. Free internet in the rooms, buffet breakfast or traditional breakfast served in the New Leaf Restaurant. There is also a happy hour with free snacks and I think half price drinks. Hotel does not have an Executive Floor, but you get free breakfast coupons to compensate. Hotel is located within walking distant to many restaurants and bars. Close to Petco Park, and across the street from the convention center. You can purchase Trolley City tour tickets from the concierge for $34.00 at trolley station for $30.00 Trolley (tour is very enjoyable). Hop on and hop off. Yes the train tracks do run across from the hotel, but sound of the train did not bother us. I want to say a special thanks to Melody and Tiffany for their wonderful “Hilton Hospitality”. Yes! I would stay here again! P. S. I have also stayed at the Hilton Bayfront and can compare. I like the Hilton Gaslamp because the people are warmer and willing to help. Hotel is cozy. Hilton Bayfront is a high rise Convention Hotel. Staff does not exhibit a warm hospitality. There are charges for every little thing. While it is a newer hotel (maybe 2 or3 years old), to me it was not constructed with the average tourist in mind. It is clearly for business and convention goers with expense accounts who do not mind the extra charges.

Reviews.Title: “Superb convention location-but don't stay in The Loft rooms”
Reviews.Author: helios5356
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights before a cruise, attracted by the Hilton.com description. It is a different Hilton--arty, sleek lobby, Gaslamp location. We were "upgraded" to a Loft room, which is across an open air space. We kept walking, the signs are adequate, but there are several non-power doors to manage--we self-carried our luggage in and out. The picture on the large flat screen TV is not HD quality--the in-room movies and TV reception is analog. We wondered why invest in nice big flat screens and then only have analog reception? The hotel caters to the convention trade, as the convention center is just across the street. This is a factor--conventions like having late-night hospitality suites (or post-hospitality parties). One of them was in the room next to ours. It was tolerable with the ear plugs they provide with a note about the trains that run in front of the hotel. We don't recommend The Loft. It has a cut-off feel from the main building, the longer walk through open air, and the rooms have higher ceilings, but nothing else better. No fridge or mini-bar. We used room service on two occasions and the service and cuisine quality were good. The afternoon manager's reception was fairly mundane hors d'oeurvres---and it's a cash bar. The breakfast buffet is interesting , and the lobby is a pretty, airy place. The staff is Hilton quality attentive. They sell zoo tickets at a small discount. The fitness center is way undersized for a busy convention hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hilton experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: tkmanthor
Reviews.Content: This hotel should come with a disclaimer: "you will not sleep here because a myriad of trains will blow their horns all night!!!!" After spending 9 luxurious nights in LaJolla, we stayed here our last night due to an early morning flight. After a great dinner in the Gaslamp district we came back to our perfectly appointed Hilton room with visions of a good night sleep prior to our 5 a.m. wake up call. NOT NEEDED! Didn't sleep due to several freight trains and other rail type vehicles speeding down the tracks in front of our hotel ALL NIGHT?!?! In the morning, I noticed that the hotel is literally ON THE TRACKS! The worst part; I burned Hilton honor points to stay here! Okay, I'm calling Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: DenverColoNative
Reviews.Content: stayed for a convention. absolutely the best location for the convention center. easy in and out to everything in the city. The service was a tremendous surprise--equivalent to a four-seasons or ritz. only one down-side--wireless was limited to the lobby which was a big inconvenience for me, but was overshadowed by the location and the service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean, well-managed property”
Reviews.Author: JoJo1Buffalo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 5 nights while visiting San Diego. Got the hotel through a bid on Priceline( $90.00 per night). It was excellent. The room was very clean, quiet, and comfortable. Beds were the most comfortable we've had in a hotel. Found the entire staff to be friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. Location was perfect. Right in the heart of the Gaslamp area-walking distance to many shops, restaurants, and a beautiful marina. Hotel offers valet parking only at $30.00 per day but we chose to use a public ramp a few blocks away for much cheaper. The valet parker actually recommended it to us! I would highly recommend this property and would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique for a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: sosweho
Reviews.Content: Hiltons in general have become rather cookie-cutter, but the Hilton Gaslamp Quarter does a great job of being unique while maintaining the brand standards. The front desk was welcoming and friendly, and as a HHonors Gold, breakfast was included. The gym is smallish, with only one bike, one Precor and two treadmills, plus limited free-weights. The location is a bit off the beaten track for San Diego's Gaslamp Quarter attractions, but literally on the railroad tracks, which can make for some mid-night wake up calls.

Reviews.Title: “Parking is $35! Yes that's righ....”
Reviews.Author: traveler5125
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Walking distance to restaurants and bars in the gas lamp area, to touristy "SeaPort Village" and to the harbor -- just cross the street cross over the convention center and wallah...great view of the ocean. There is no view of the ocean from the hotel it self. If you are looking for a view you'll need to stay at the Hilton bayfront (right across the street). I did and on my second night stayed at the Bayfront especially when I found out it was $40 cheaper per night! That area is gorgeous, so it really doesn't matter where you stay because you don't really want to spend too much time inside anyways. As for the parking its valet ONLY (no self parking available) and it's $35 included overnight and unlimited in-n-out privileges. Street parking is metered during the day, and difficult to find. You can park across at the convention center it was $10; no in-n-out allowed so it's a bit of an inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, nice location, lackluster service”
Reviews.Author: oscarrific
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ended our honeymoon trek down the California coast with a one-night stay at this Hilton property prior to flying back home. My wife booked a "romance" package, which consisted if the usual amenities (bottle of champagne, free breakfast, etc.) in one of their "loft" rooms, which was located in an adjacent building connected to the main hotel via outdoor terrace. This property is literally located in the heart of the Gaslamp District, and is within walking distance of just about anything "tourist-y." The location would be great for a baseball fan, as it is within walking distance of Petco Park, or for a conventioneer, as it is also steps away from the monolithic San Diego Convention Center and feet away from the light rail/trolley line (and evidently a switching line for the Santa Fe Railroad as well). The physical property is very much the hip, modern, urban design that is popular in downtown redevelopment projects and is very tastefully done. The property sits in a sort of cul-de-sac, so it is fairly easy to find. Seeing the hotel as we drove up to it, I thought that we had found the ideal location. Unfortunately, this is also where our frustration with the level of guest service started. We arrived at the hotel about 1pm and were informed that our room was "not ready." Ok, that is acceptable. We were also asked for our phone number and that we would be contacted when the room opened, which was to be in one hour...as check-in time was 3pm, I could see this as a plausible scenario..perhaps the hotel was sold out and they simply weren't ready, which is a relatively poor excuse but it could happen. One hour elapsed. Nothing. We had walked around the Gaslamp District and grabbed a bite to eat. We parked our rental car in a metered stall just outside the hotel, so we had to consider that our meter time was not unlimited and we were parked in a two-hour maximum stall. Having not been called yet, we stopped by at 2pm (the promised time), and were told by a differet front desk agent that the room still was not ready, but that housekeeping had been given a "rush" order to turn the room around. Ok, now what? As an aside, we overheard another guest next to us trying to check in also, and they were given the same lip service as we were..they were not as understanding as we were. Well, we decided to drive up and down Harbor Drive as we were pretty bored and getting more frustrated. So, we stall and stall and now 3pm comes...still nothing from the hotel. Finally, at 3:30pm, we get a call that the room is ready. We pulled our vehicle up to the valet stand and tell the attendant we only want to check in, which he was nice enough to hold our keys while we did this. (By the way, valet is the only option the hotel allows, and is $35/nt. There are a few public parking garages in the immediate area that are half that price (but with no in/out privileges), so we decided to stash the car in a public garage two blocks over for $18/night and just walk around the Gaslamp District...it worked for us. So we complete the check-in process and make our way to our "loft" room. As cool as these higher-priced rooms are. they're not easy to get to, and there are no automatic doors into the area where the rooms are that stay open to allow you to wheel your luggage in. After getting into the room, we wanted to walk around some more, but realized that our "romance package" amenities had not even been mentioned to us at check-in or delivered to our room. My wife called the front desk and asked about it, to which the front desk agent stated that they would send someone immediately...waited about one hour...nothing. I called and asked where our stuff was...15 minutes later it shows up. Finally, now we are set, but lost the Hilton "mo-jo" we experienced in the Hilton family properties we stayed at throughout coastal California. We certainy did not feel like valued overnight guests at a cost of $250. As a Hilton HHonors member, I chose nothing but Hilton family properties for our entire California honeymoon (Downtown San Francisco - Hilton, Monterey-Hilton Garden Inn, San Luis Obispo-Embassy Suites, Los Angeles-Hilton, San Diego-Hilton) because I am used to their normally great service...and the Hilton Gaslamp was the most expensive one out of all of them, and also the most disappointing in terms of service. Granted, nothing that happened was earth-shattering, but it was enough to make me publicly say that I would not stay here again. Even if I weren't an HHonors member, I would have the same commentary. There is another Hilton property, a beautiful new high-rise, just south of the Convention Center on the waterfront. Not as cool-looking, but certainly another (and possibly better) option. Heck, there is a Hard Rock Hotel next to the Hilton Gaslamp that I would try as well next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: mokate17
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally about 50 yards from the major CSX train tracks. I was woken about every two hours to my room rumbling and the engine horn blasting multiple times. In the morning I figured out that the hotel is right next to the switch point, so the trains sit there and wait for the green light, and then blow their horns to get rolling again. There is nothing special about this hotel to overlook the noise. If you want ANY sleep, just don't stay there! Also, this is the only hotel I've EVER been to that charged me $5 to include a FedEx package in their daily pick-up (I have a FedEx account where the shipping was being charged, I needed no supplies, this was literally a charge to add it to their pick-up pile, which every other hotel I've ever stayed with does for free)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mmissner
Reviews.Content: We got the Hilton Gaslamp Quarter through Priceline. The hotel is very attractive, furnished in 20th century mid century modern. The room was large, but the bathroom quite small. There is a stress on being green with low flushing Toto toilets, and motion sensitive bathroom lights. We had to call to find out how to turn the bathroom light off. We couldn't! it was a set to go off in 11 minutes. The hotel is right across the street from the convention center and our room looked over the center and the train tracks. With the help of a sound spa for white noise, we did not hear the train, and slept well. It is nice that the windows open. Bedside lamps are tall and I had to get out of bed to turn it off. We found a parking lot around the corner which charged $10 for 24 hours as opposed to the valet parking at the hotel. The internet was on the slow side, but free for Hilton Gold card members. We had a very nice breakfast at the Broken Yolk, right around the corner. We could walk to many attractions. Nice location, and a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: txpilgrim
Reviews.Content: Great location. The property is at the entrance of the Gaslamp district. There are a few bars/lounges nearby but the hotel is a few blocks from most bars/lounges which I actually preferred (less noise & foot traffic). There are several great restaurants a few feet from the hotel but beware; many close at midnight. I recommend the Strip Club (1 block over). Crazy name but it's a good steakhouse, nice atmosphere & the experience of grilling your own steak was fun. I stayed in a king room in the Lofts portion of the hotel. Nice room albeit small. For those light sleepers in the Loft I suggest staying in a room that has a window facing the terrace (rather than K Street). My room faced the street and there was some noise from a terrace party at the Hard Rock across the street. The noise wasn't overbearing but might cause difficulty for some. There's a nice trail in front of the hotel for a nice morning jog. Pleasant staff. Concierge was helpful. Parking is expensive ($35/night) but given the area it might be standard. I received breakfast vouchers & it was a pleasant surprise. Also, it's a full breakfast; not just continental. If you plan on being in the Gaslamp district I recommend considering this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry to say this hotel stinks, literally.”
Reviews.Author: ShadowKC
Reviews.Content: There is some kind of sewer gas issue around this hotel. The lobby and outside areas always smell like sewer gas. I'm not sure if this has something to do with the train line that runs right by it but it really ruins the experience the second you get off the elevators. NOTE: if you have a car you will have to pay $35 a day for valet parking. The valet service is fast but there is no way to get around it. Bring money to tip. The rooms are ok, I have never stayed in another hotel in San Diego so I don't have anything to compare it to. Beds were comfy but the sound proofing in the hotel is awful. You can hear everything from the hall and the adjacent rooms. The ice machine kept me up all night. The location is awesome. You are within walking distance of tons of dinning, entertainment, tourist stuff, convention center, the bay and a walking path. Service was not spectacular. We told them about a broken toilet seat that they were going to "fix right away" and after a week at their hotel no one ever came to fix it. For the price, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but you can't avoid the NOISY train!”
Reviews.Author: pokerpro05
Reviews.Content: The Hilton San Diego Gaslamp Quarter is a pretty good hotel. As far as the hotel itself goes, I only have 3 minor complaints: 1) Parking is really expensive ($35/day), though cheaper parking exists for like $15 nearby. Still, you are getting almost no discount as a guest. Anyone can walk in off the street and get a rate of $12 per 8 hours for parking there. 2) The bathroom door auto-closes. What could possibly be the reason for installing a device to do this? 3) Would not recommend restaurant for breakfast. It was overpriced and the service was lousy. The room itself is nice. The property itself is also good, and the location is excellent. There's just one real "gotcha" that you have to watch out for: It's RIGHT NEXT TO a very noisy train! The train itself wouldn't be so bad, but the conductor blows the horn a ridiculous number of times on each pass. He has no consideration for the time of night, and it appears he doesn't blow the horn just to warn nearby cars or pedestrians. He just likes blowing it, and he does so often. If you are a light sleeper, you will DEFINITELY be woken up at all times of the night and morning by this train. If you are not a light sleeper, you will still probably wake up a few times from it. If you have sleep issues, you definitely should stay away from this hotel and any hotels close to it. I considered changing rooms, but I came to realize that the train's horn was so loud that it would not help. Something to think about if you're going to book here. The Gaslamp district is very nice. Lots of places to eat there, very safe, and 2 blocks from Petco Park, home of the San Diego Padres. I took a very nice 2-hour tour there for $9, where they even gave me a free SD Padres cap. Definitely do this if you're a baseball fan. You can walk there from the hotel. Oh, and you get free internet, but it's NOT wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hilton - decent rooms, well located, nicely appointed”
Reviews.Author: rowingman
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice, beds are great, no complaints. I sleep well, but did note the train engineer's attempt to alter my experience (multiple horn blasts at 2am, but hey, I am on East Coast time, so 2am here is coffee time in DC....). Bathroom is nice, but has a motion sensor on the lighting which actually shut off a couple of times while I was in the shower. I am as "green as the next guy", but the auto shut off light, combined with a closer on the bathroom door meant showering in the pitch dark. For the less adventurous soul it might have been dangerous. Combination of price, location, decor, great breakfast location makes this a great value and nice place to stay. Hilton is a superior brand. Don't take my comments as negative. I am not picky. This is a good value in a very modern room. A very comfortable stay. Staff was courteous and professional. Room is spotless. Hoping the hotel reads this: the fitness center could use some TLC (TV on elliptical is not functional, headsets not cleaned, stocked, no clock in fitness room, check overall cleanliness in fitness center). Again,small things. I like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Is it really necessary for the train conductor to blow its whistle 10 times at 2 a.m.?”
Reviews.Author: otsthedog
Reviews.Content: Although very convenient to great restaurants, the train noise would keep me from staying at the hotel again. On the way back to the airport, the cabbie told me that the area hotels had sued and lost in court because the train was there first. And, I wouldn't mind the noise of a train or a single whistle blowing event. But, it wasn't even close to that ---- the train blew the whistle ten times!! And, yes, since it woke me up, I did count. The Hilton has done its best to mitigate the noise by nicely providing disposal ear plugs with a little sign entitled "Sounds of the City" where it explains that not everyone enjoys the whistle blowing --- and that sometimes, the train conductor gets "carried away." The conductor got carried away every night I was there! Only a single pair of ear plugs were provided --- I guess if I wasn't alone, I would have had to fight my husband for them. Or, maybe the Hilton might have provided a second pair --- I don't know. I was on the 12th floor overlooking the train tracks. Maybe another room wouldn't be as bad. Anyway, other than that, the hotel is nice. Free internet is provided --- but, not wifi. Nice lobby lounge with free snacks in the evening and $4-5 beer and house wine. USA Today delivered to rooms and Financial Times available in lobby. Room had an automatic, timed light in the bathroom -- which was fine except that in the middle of the night, the light seemed to stay on forever.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: Athayde
Reviews.Content: Nice bedrooms perfect for the Family , the staff were very helpfull specialy at the Bar, the view was great and it only took us 5 minutes to walk to all the restaurants and Bars

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jon160
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on the weekend before Christmas. We were impressed. Every staff member smiled, and that was typical of our stay. Clean, quiet rooms, excellent location. Got a rate on Hilton.com which was lower than we thought we'd pay if we used priceline or hotwire. We parked at the public lot at 6th and K, 2 short blocks away, rather than use the valet. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: deejal
Reviews.Content: The location of Hilton San Diego Gaslamp Quarter cannot be beat. It's directly across from the San Diego Convention Center and there are 2 trolley stops within 1 minute walking. The hotel boasts an earthtone atmosphere and welcomes guests with open arms. There was a manager's reception with complimentary hos d'oeuvres and reduced adult drink specials. The manager's reception was on a Thursday night and I didn't see it any other night of the weekend but really wasn't looking for it. I am upset with the Hilton brand of hotel because I had emailed Hilton through the HHonors desk and I received a response indicating that my concerns had been passed along to the Hilton San Diego Gaslamp management. Apparently, my email from corporate to office was never passed along to the hotel or the hotel management ignored my email. There are a few discrepancies on the website that I pointed out but apparently nobody cares. There are 3 train tracks directly in front of the hotel. Upon check-in, I specifically requested that I would prefer a room not facing the tracks and I was reassured that I would not be able to hear the trains from room 528. The minute I opened the door to my guest room, I could hear the train. I tried to switch rooms but nothing else available. Well, that's fine, I can deal with the trains at all hours of the day and night. I also requested that I not be placed any where near the ice machine/vending area. I was placed directly across the hall from the ice/vending area. I would close the door to the vending area daily and housekeeping would open it. The door was so loud that I finally left the door open. The hotel should invest in automatic door closers that GENTLY close the door to the vending area. Housekeeping was great and prompt and the room was cleaned upon request. There is no mini-bar in the guest rooms even though the website clearly indicates a mini-bar is present. The hotel guidebook placed in the room even explains how to operate the mini-bar but...there is no mini-bar. I, for one, have no problems paying the exorbitant prices for mini-bar drinks because when I am thirsty, I am going to drink. The New Leaf restaurant has a wonderful breakfast buffet and patrons may order from the menu as well. The breakfast food is very good and reasonably priced. There are many many staff members working in the restaurant during breakfast. However, the night staff member, Michael, has to run the whole show by himself. Not only is he the bartender, he is also the server and the wait was 40 minutes from the time the steak was ordered until it was delivered. The menu located outside The New Leaf restaurant indicates that a NY Strip steak is available...however... it's not. The hotel does not focus on details and that disturbs me. But, it's personal preference. The hotel room was fine. The rooms are smaller but normal for California. The rooms are nicely appointed and lighting is VERY good for a hotel. The bed is comfortable but the pillows are simply awful. I am not sure why hotels think everyone wants super fluffy pillows?!? Hotels should invest in posturepedic pillows or make them available upon request. The guest rooms feature what appears to be a 42 inch flat screen LCD television. The only drawback is the hotel does NOT offer ANY stations/channels in HD broadcast. I would prefer a normal TV with standard definition versus a LCD flat panel without HD. The TV features typical hotel programming with one of those funny remotes that do everything except allow you to simply turn up the volume and/or change the channel. The bathroom is nicely appointed and has automatic lights. The automatic light engages when the guest enters to the bathroom but stays on for 20 minutes and I find this wasteful. Shower pressure is fine. Crabtree and Evelyn products are available for your disposal. All in all, this hotel is very nice and well appointed. Despite the minor flaws (that can easily be fixed) I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Anniversary at the Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: SCTraveler864
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent two nights at the Hilton Gaslamp for our anniversary. I'm HHonors Diamond and had requested a room upgrade on reservation. The hotel went above and beyond and graciously offered us a Junior Presidential Suite in the Lofts section of the hotel. It was perhaps the best room we've ever had. The hotel is very convenient to the Gaslamp Quarter, the breakfast buffet was very nice, the small pool area was great as well. Yes there is a train and the parking is pricey but other than that this was an exceptional stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay great location”
Reviews.Author: MissJasmine
Reviews.Content: Hilton San Diego Gasslamp QUarter 3rd October 2009 We arrived in the port of San Diego after a 2 week cruise and as is the case with cruise lines, you are often off the ship before 9am. We had faxed the hotel several weeks prior to our arrival and asked if we could have an early check in for the above reason.
