First off- great location- lots of restaurants and bars. The room was nice, a King Deluxe in the Lofts area of the hotel. Big enough but fairly umnremarkable. Boring bathroom. nothing fancy. The first night we were there was a Thursday night, and my husaband had just arrived in CA from the East Coast to meet me after I had been on business in San Fran, and he feel asleep pretty early and easily. However I was in CA for almost a week at this point and closer to West Coast time, so I stayed up a bit and noticed a very annoying, pounding bass sound emanating through our room. My husband slept through it, so I thought maybe it wasn't as bad as I thought. I defintley should have asked the next morning to be moved. Our room looked out over the outside patio area of the Hard Rock Hotel bar, and that was the culprit. The noise got worse each noght and went on later each night. We never complained and asked to be moved, which we should have done, so that was our fault. Between the time-difference, and being exhausted from the day's activities and having imbibed several (rough estimate) cocktails we did sleep, but be careful when you check in. I think it is a very few number of rooms that have this problem, but if you are a light sleeper be aware and ask to be away from the 5th Avenue side of the hotel. We had room service breakfast one day and it was good, pretty expensive, but we were slow-moving that day, so worth it! We had the breakfast buffet another morning which was very good, but pricey ($18.95, but free for me as a diamond member of Hilton Honors, so this a great deal if you are a gold or diamond member and like breakfast- plus it was served until 11:00 am, which we love, cause we don't get up early on vacation!). That all said, I would stay here again, just ask for a room away from 5th.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ktraphagen
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay here based on TripAdvisor reviews. I stayed for a week... coming early to a conference so that I could enjoy San Diego for a bit. This is a smaller Hilton and I think that is one of its best assets. The staff knew me and greeted me when I came through the lobby. I never had to wait for an elevator or have it stop on every single floor of a 30 floor hotel (like some of my friends who stayed in the larger hotels did). My room was on the 11th floor (with a view of the convention center and the marina) and was always well taken care of. One day I left a note for housekeeping asking for an extra bottle of conditioner since I have long hair. The staff remembered that request and left extra in the bathroom for the rest of my stay. One day I happened to be in the room around lunchtime when they came to clean the room. After I left I just notified the front desk that I had been in the room when they wanted to clean it but that I would be out for a few hours and they could come now. It was no problem. The pool is small, but the concierge gave me instructions for using a lap pool nearby. There was a basket of fresh green apples at the reception desk everyday. Usual amenities in the room (ironing board, hair dryer, etc). One appreciated perk is the free internet access. Several other hotels had daily additional charges for this service. Also, there is a free kiosk in the lobby so that you can print out your boarding pass and check-in online for your flights. This hotel ended up being closer to the side of the Convention Center where our conference was (South side) than the anchor hotel (Marriott). Great opportunities for eating abound within walking distance. The staff is excellent. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great City, good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lmalf
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there for a week during the summer of 2007. It was in a great location for everything that we wanted to do. Everything was pretty much in walking distance except for the zoo and some other things but it was very easy to get a taxi (expense though). The best shopping centers are in walking distance! I loved them! The stadium for the padres was so close and great to walk to for the game! There were some negative things about this hotel ... It is very close to the train tracks and the trains run ALL the time. The pool is very small and only has like 4 chairs plus a sofa thing. I stayed in the lofts which was very nice and big but took a long time to get there. Also, don't go when they have an event going on. There was some big event half of the week that used the patio and everyone was all dressed up so everytime you left the room or tried to go to your room you felt like you are interupting something. And don't expect your room to be cleaned until REALLY LATE or REALLY EARLY. I bet you the cleaning cart stayed in our hallway at least 6 hours everyday ( and we only had about 10 rooms). We gave up on it after the 3rd day. The room service was okay just really expensive. The sports bar down the street is AMAZING! It was a great stay i recommend going to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “horrible very expensive room”
Reviews.Author: delmarie
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite for a nice getaway. It must have been the worst room on the property. Our view was of a vast tarpaper covered roof outside the window. There was only one mirror in the entire suite - in the bathroom. There was no minibar and no hot water till my husband called the staff, who came up promptly to fix it, and told us we just had to run the water a long time. A very long time. We were disappointed. It was an expensive suite. They should not rent this room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cardinals1970
Reviews.Content: Great location! My wife and I wanted to stay in the Gaslamp area as we heard great things about the shops and restaurants in the area. The hotel is very nice and plush! My wife fell in love with the bedding and the overall ambience was great. We dined and shopped in the Gaslamp quarter and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The "Lofts" Is Where It Is At!”
Reviews.Author: Wiley12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gaslamp Hilton as a "home base" in the Gaslamp for a night out on the town. We chose to pay a little bit extra and stay in the "Lofts" which are the hotel within the hotel. Lots of walking to get to the room but once we got there we were very happy with the room. Very large room with high ceilings that made the room seem even larger. Wonderful bed, lots of windows, very comfy feeling. I do not understand why the TV's in the hotel are still the old box TV's instead of newer up to date flat screens that most newer/more expensive hotels seem to have. Room service was great the next morning. Very fast. Would stay there again but we usually hop from hotel to hotel in the gaslamp when we stay down there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: broomea
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 4 nights (10/16-10/20) through Priceline. Got the first two nights for $100/night and the second two nights for $120. Great deal for this hotel. Location is fantastic for the Gaslamp nightlife. Noise from the train and trolley could be heard, but it didn't bother me. It is just part of the sounds of San Diego. Pool was small, but enjoyable. The staff were courteous and helpful. The beds were so comfortable. Room was very clean. I was surprised that the TV had not been updated. But I guess they are saving the upgrades for the new Hilton being built across the street beside the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go if you want to rest or sleep”
Reviews.Author: yellowlab39
Reviews.Content: Got a super low rate via a web site, but am regretting staying at this hotel - big time. The location is across street from the convention center - but also next to a freight train yard (tracks are about 50 feet from my room window). The loud hum of diesel train engines and train horns ALL NIGHT LONG was crazy. I am not a light sleeper, and don't need complete quiet to sleep, but this was ridiculous. The hotel offered a free breakfast as compensation. THe roms are large and nicely decorated, but that's not enough to return. For me, I'll stay somewhere else next time that's not next to rails.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but not family friendly”
Reviews.Author: amorelli
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and the rooms are beautiful. I was able to get it for $130 a night on priceline.com. The thing that sucks is they charge $30 A NIGHT for parking and there is no self park. I thought that was a bit much. The front desk is not very friendly and I felt like other staff in the hotel gave us some rotten looks for having a 2 year old. I would suggest this hotel to the business man not the family visiting SeaWorld. Oh also, you can hear the train from your room......

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: RelaxSD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with my girlfriend to spend the night in the Gaslamp - going to dinner and to enjoy some nitelife. Super quick check in service. Room was very good size .. very clean and very nice decor. The best thing is that you walk right outside the door of the hotel and everything you could possibly want is within walking distance ( shopping, dining, nitelife, convention center, Petco Park etc. ) Definitley would reccomend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice , but pricey”
Reviews.Author: a12barblues
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay . Hotel itself is very nice more boutique like than any Hilton we have ever stayed at. Excellent service from the valet to the housekeeping. Small pool area but adequate for the hotel size and a very small jaquzzi. If possible request room on a higher floor as outside noise is very audible if your like us and like the windows open for the cool breeze in the evening. As noted before $30 a night for parking plus tips. Which is on the high side but really didn't want the hassel of finding street parking everyday and there are quite abit of homeless folks just sort of meandering around. Hotel bar and resturant we thought were a bit on the pricey side. Went to Petco and watched my Giants get there tails beat. But it was cool just having to walk 2 blocks to get there. Bathroom on the small side but again well stocked with shampoos, soap , towels ect. We were on the 10th floor of 12 and had a small view of the bay , dont know if it got any better on the 11 & 12th floors. We used some of our HGVC points to book room , but I don't know if we would have been as happy with hotel if we had paid the $300 a night that they were charging for our room. So in summary it was one of those 6 of one , half a dozen of the other situations. Just depends on what your priorities are. But as they say " a day on vacation is better that any day at work" .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business & pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Coastal-Travelers
Reviews.Content: Although the Hilton Gaslamp is located right across the street from the San Diego Convention Center, it is definitely not a typical "convention hotel". The decor is more like a "boutique hotel" and the staff were some of the best I've ever encountered - especially in a city hotel. Everyone was exceptionally friendly and helpful and all went out of their way to make sure that we enjoyed all that the hotel had to offer. We arrived early in the day (around 12 Noon) and had already planned on waiting for a room on an upper floor (thanks to Trip Advisor). The desk clerk actually gave us that option, before we even asked. It was worth the wait for a 12th floor room facing the Convention Center - great sunset view and high enough to avoid the train noise. The room was average size with interesting decor, a great desk, huge windows and a very comfortable bed. No refrigerator but they offered to bring us one when I asked. Good lighting in the bathroom, plenty of hot water and soft, fluffy towels. The housekeeping service was excellent the entire week. We did not have time to use the spa but I did get a tour. The first impression is not great because the entrance leads right into the hair salon which is busy, noisy and too brightly lit but once you get back into the spa, it becomes much quieter and everything was spotlessly clean. The one major negative we found was the price of the mandatory valet parking - $30 per day! I understand this is a city hotel but this seemed higher than any of the nearby properties. The staff were very nice and always speedy but the price still seemed out of line with the rest of the services offered. Overall, a great downtown hotel and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad...”
Reviews.Author: nrsimmons
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Hilton Gaslamp Quarter. My fiancee and I stayed here over Labor Day weekend. We arrived at the hotel at 12 noon. We arrived early due to the San Diego Padres game that started at 1:05pm(Petco Park is a five minute walk). We left our luggage with the bellman. We came back after the game at about 4:00pm, the front desk informed me that the room I reserved was not available (junior suite). At first it appeared as if she was not going to upgrade me, but I gave her "the look" and she upgraded me to one of their higher suites. The suite was in a different building known as "The Lofts on 5th Avenue." I appreciated the free upgrade, but was a little irritated that the original room was not available. How does that happen if I already reserved it online? Anyways, the upgraded suite was fine. There was a jacuzzi inside which helped us unwind after our long days of seeing San Diego's sights. I live near Los Angeles and come to San Diego quite often. This was the first time I have stayed in the Gaslamp Quarter. I usually stay in Mission Valley or Hotel Circle area. I would return, but just make sure your room is available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: rbloede
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked thru the hotel doors it was one of the best hotels stays I have experienced. The hotel is updated and very modern looking. The front desk was just wonderful. They were great from check in until we said our farewells on Friday. We had a beautiful room on the 9th floor on the corner (meaning we had a window on each wall) that overlooked the conv. center. The pool area may look small but it was perfect for the amount of people that used it. The fitness center was updated with all new equipment and was good for the amount you might need to do on vacation. The location was key for this hotel. Anyone that is attending a Padre game or wants a place that is close to shopping and restaurants this is the place to be. The tram picks up right in front of the hotel also. Some things I have read are very true like Parking cost and noise. Let me explain a few things. There is a parkade parking ramp on the corner of 6th and k (about a two block walk) that is much cheaper than the valet parking at the hotel (which is 30.00 a night) The cost at the parkade is either $8.00 overnight on a non event night and $12.00 on event nights. This option worked well for us as we would leave in the morning and come back later in the day. If you need to come and go many times you might want to do the valet parking as that is unlimited come and go options. The next thing is the noise. Yes the train and tram go past many times and you can hear the crossing things ding and the noise of the tram also. I got numb to it, and it really did not bother me. My husband is a lighter sleeper and it did wake him up during the night. My answer to this is, if you are staying at a downtown hotel you should expect noise in any city. Just be aware that it might be a factor if you are a light sleeper. I do not take these into account when I rate this hotel as like I said I expect to pay for parking and to have noise when staying downtown. The location is right next to the Gaslamp District. You easily can walk out your door and dine at the most casual to your nicest steak and seafood type place. With outside seating this area is beautiful. There is all types of food to choose from also. I booked this hotel thru priceline and I am so glad this is the one that met my match. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone that might be going on vacation or has a event at the convention center (right across the street). A big thank you to all the people who worked at the hotel from the front desk to the maids that brought us towels after we forgot to take our DND sign off the door and did not get maid service that day. You are all wonderful and helped make my San Diego Trip one of the best US locations I have traveled to Thank you Thank you Thank You!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LAGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton for one night. As others stated, it is located in a excellent location within walking distance to many restaurants, clubs and the Petco Park. The room was clean and we really liked the modern decor. The train noise did not bother us at all. The pool and jacuzzi area is small but when we used the amenities at night, it was not crowded at all. The check in staff was great and let us check into our room at 10am because we arrived to San Diego very early. I highly recommend this hotel, especially if you are planning on catching a game in the nearby stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great experience”
Reviews.Author: drcookie
Reviews.Content: My wife, my 4-year old son and I have just came back from our weekend break from San Diego. We bid the hotel through priceline, so we have no option of choosing the hotel. We stayed at the 4th floor overlooking the Convention center. As all the reviewers have mentioned, next to the hotel is the Amtrak rail road as well as San Diego Transit light rail. If your ears are sensitive to the noise of trains crossing as well as the ringing of the gates, stay way from this hotel. However, we felt this "train" thing was part of the entertainment for my son. He could sit by the windows for quite sometime just to see the Amtrak freight trains passing by. Overall, we have great experience. The hotel is clean, the beds are comfortable, the staff are friendly and the location (besides the train tracks) is great. The parking is $30/night (valet only) and I guess other 4-star hotels around the area would charge similar rate. We did not use the pool nor the gym so we can't comment on those.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and definitely somewhere we would return to”
Reviews.Author: twiddy
Reviews.Content: Just finished a stay at this hotel with my husband and daughter. Have to say the rooms were lovely and clean, as was all of the hotel. The staff were all very helpful and the breakfast buffet of very good value. If there was any negative aspect it would have to be the Amtrak train that seemed to go past our window around midnight every night blowing its horn!! But then you can't move the railway track. Have to say that aside we still had a wonderful time there and the location is excellent for everything.

Reviews.Title: “odd balcony, but otherwise great hotel in perfect location for city break”
Reviews.Author: FussyChinaGirl
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the lofts & upgraded to a room with a choice of either a jacuzzi or balcony. we opted for balcony. we were not told that the balcony came directly off the bathroom! (see picture) after the long drive from vegas, we were too tired to complain or ask to move rooms. we mentioned it upon checking out & they deducted an amount from the final bill because we were not able to enjoy use of the balcony. that aside, this is a great hotel in a perfect location for a city break. yes, there is some 'noise' but what do you expect when you're right in the middle of town & next to the tramline... we rather enjoyed hearing the city life. stay further out of town if you're a light sleeper! the front-desk check-in was not particularly welcoming on arrival, but the guy helping us with our luggage was great - asked what we wanted to do, had suggestions etc. the pool area is small & quickly fills up in busy periods, but if you can get there & grab a day-bed they are very comfortable. it's a little weird being so close to the tramline, but you soon get used to it. the towels are refreshed regularly & although there is no lifeguard, it is patrolled (2 security guards quitely and politely asked a young couple to step out of the jacuzzi as they were, er, 'petting' a little too much, and there were families with young children present.) some may complain about the lack of mini-bar in the room, but who needs them anyway?! shops and bars are a very short walk away - there is even a cafe right underneath the hotel if you can't manage to get across to the other side of the street!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for the convention center”
Reviews.Author: espritnumber5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location for the convention center - just across the street. The only other hotel as close is the Omni. If you are attending a conference, it is incredibly easy to pop into the hotel between sessions, or to drop off your conference goodies before heading into the gaslamp district for dinner. Other attendees would drop off their conference bags in my room before dinner, then go back to pick them up! The room was a handicapped-accessible room, and enormous as a result. Great bathroom amenities, very comfortable beds, the bedside clock with an input cable for you to plug into your MP3 player, etc. I was on the 5th floor in the regular part of the hotel. I ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant twice and it was very nice both times, but right across the street (to the north) is a small convience store / eatery where you can get coffee and breakfast for a fraction of the cost. I arrived very early in the morning - 8am - intending just to drop off my bags and head to the convention center, but they quickly found an available room and booked me in, so I was able to drop off my bags very early.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Getzmrt
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Hilton and loved it! The staff was warm and friendly. The hotel is modern and comfortable. The location can't be beat - we were able to walk to Petco Park for the ballgame and also walked to great restaurants and shopping. We had breakfast at Richard Walker's Pancake house. It was incredible and worth the short wait.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: drew4392
Reviews.Content: First of all, I booked this room through Priceline. Price was $105/night. If I had to pay double, or more, I would have rated the hotel a bit lower-- probably down to neutral/average. The Gaslamp area is expensive! I hear a lot of people whining about parking fees. Thats everywhere! If you want to save $10, then park at a private parking lot a couple blocks from your Gaslamp hotel and walk. Parking is expensive there. End of story. Hotels in this area are pricey. I know this hotel is usually about $200+/-. For this type of hotel (avg/above avg), this is the price. If you want to spend less, then you are going to get less. Again, the area is pricey! Now onto the hotel: Pro's: Clean, modern rooms. Avg size (400 sq ft +/-), newer, nice bathroom (above avg), nice shower head, and comfortable beds. Pillow top mattress. Nice pillows. Not your typical disposable bed. Down comforter. Small but useful desk and comfy chair for working, or whatever. 23-27in tube TV. Typical. Overall, nice. Above avg. Room service is quick (25min) and food was above avg. Staff is very friendly. Con's: Again, prefacing this because people tend to find the slightest things to complain about. You are in the Gaslamp district. There is traffic on the streets at ALL hours. Very busy, happening place. You MIGHT hear something at night. Like, cars, horns, music, etc. The walls are not pure lead. Not soundproof. And it is very minimal. And this is IF you happen to hear something. Saturday morning I did hear a train's whistle. This is mentioned in the other reviews. Lasted about 21 seconds. I got over it. Not the end of the world. Just my $.02

Reviews.Title: “Not that impressed....”
Reviews.Author: justmewonderinginyuma
Reviews.Content: First of all, the parking fee is ridiculous. We had two vehicles so parking for one night was $60.00. I will not stay here again. The hotel itself was nice, although small. The good deal you get on websites goes away considering parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but. . . .”
Reviews.Author: jsamuel
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Lofts, nice but overpriced for amenities. Refrigerator not standard in this upscale room. Had to request one, but was not charged. Had to pay for internet access in Business Center. (I hate when hotels do that). Concierge was very accomadating. Hotel parking was extremely expensive, bu have no choice. Breakfast buffet was excellent, although people need to control their children ~ not hotels fault. Sitting area and sleeping area not segregated (would think it would be for $300 a night) with two TV's. Didn't need 2 since could see them both from anywhere in the room. Nice hotel overall, but probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pillows, wonderful maid, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: morningjoy
Reviews.Content: Tony's work booked the hotel. The bed was wonderful! I heard the train during the day, but slept well at night. Did hear some partying on one night. The maid was wonderfully sweet. I loved the breakfast bar. Priced for the area. Next time, I would rent a car and see more of the sites! We saw a lot, but could have done more. Oh, the waiters & waitresses at their restaraunt were wonderful as is the Itallian restaurant next door.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad place to stay, be weary tho'”
Reviews.Author: travelladybug2007
Reviews.Content: we only stayed there one night but great looking room, very clean and very chic design, the only problem was that there was a train going by during the night which woke us up as well as some drunk chick but if you don't mind that it's a great little hotel to stay at..........

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Awful Day Spa”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust516
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel located right in Gaslamp!! Front desk was exceptional! Always friendly, courteous and willing to go the extra mile. When I've stayed at hotels before and they knew that I purchased the room through a discounter (priceline, hotwire, etc) I would receive nominal service and probably a nominal room too. Not the case with this hotel! My entire family stayed for a mini-reunion (we had kids all the way through my parents who are in their 70s). The only thing I would say otherwise is that this hotel is probably geared more towards the business traveler or the adult who is looking to stay in the midst of the vibrant downtown scene. Not too much for my niece & nephew who are both under 6. Pool is ok, but small and not much of a "playzone." Lastly - the day spa that's attached to the hotel, Artesia Day Spa is absolutely awful. I booked a massage for my sis-in-law to surprise her for her birthday (which was the day we arrived). The first person who booked my appointment was friendly. However, when I called on the day of the appt to inquire about pushing back my sister's appt since we were delayed in our travel plans, the receptionist took that as me cancelling my appointment and didn't even call to confirm. So when my sister and I showed up (on time since we rushed to the hotel!) at the spa, we were met with the rudest employee who told her that her appointment was cancelled and there was nothing to do they could do about it. However, the masseus that was going to be assigned to my sister was standing right there (they were looking at her to see if she'd stay and the masseus walked out the front door). Then when we asked if there were any other appointments available during our brief stay, we were met with a stern no. When I left the spa and went back to call from my room to speak with a manager, the receptionist told me that she didn't know who the manager was and that managers had weird schedules - in other words, she knew it was me trying to speak with someone higher than her. I've worked in hotels before and service that we received at the spa is something that is just unacceptable! My sister was sorely disappointed and was a downpoint to our otherwise exquisite stay at the Hilton. Definitely recommend the hotel, definitely not the day spa.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for the Nightlife”
Reviews.Author: TaliaT
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here complimentary of his work, so of course free is always nice. Prior to my arrival, my boyfriend had added me to his room so that i could get a key if he wasnt there. The front desk was rude and explained that although I was on the guest list for the room, that did not allow me a key as I was not on the original itinerary. Fair enough I suppose since this makes it more secure. At any rate, the stay was enjoyable. The restaurant in the lobby has some killer food and drinks. Its in a great location if you are into the nightlife that San Diego has to offer. Be warned that although this is a great location, it is also close to downtown so you will experience more noise than you may be use to. Being from Vegas...im use to the noise.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel at a ridiculous price.”
Reviews.Author: LizardOC
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness for discount booking sites! We enjoyed our overnight stay at the Hilton at a price tag of $100, but had we paid the full rate of $200+, we'd have been sorely disappointed. Valet parking is the only option, and at $30 per night, it's highway robbery. The room was pleasant but small (and the decor a little garish for my tastes, but your mileage may vary!). The desk staff was delightful, but housekeeping didn't seem to know we were checking out, so they knocked on our door while we were trying to sleep in. The faucet fell apart in my hands and the bathroom fan didn't work. There was no minibar, which we didn't mind, but there WERE two small bottles of water in the room.....at a cost of $5.00 each. Seriously, when you're paying $250 for a hotel room and parking, should you really have to get stiffed for bottled water too? If you stay here, understand that you're paying for the great location, not for a luxury hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay. Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Danni0005
Reviews.Content: I loved thgis hotel! I got a really great rate, and enjoyed every second of staying here--EXCEPT the $30 valet parking. OUCH. Staff was very friendly. My room was awesome. Bed comfy. TV's could be updated though. Lobby bar closed early, and a mini bar in the room would have been nice. Location could not be better. I was going to Pads game, and the ballpark is right there. I loved the vibe of this place. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: lozaman
Reviews.Content: We spent our anniversary weekend here. Our room was in the "hotel within the hotel" which is a separate wing of lofts (essentially a large suite with 14 foot ceilings and large windows). Our room was on a corner overlooking the intersection of K St and 5th Avenue, so there was always lots to see, especially since there were two Cinco De Mayo festivals going on right below us. With the windows closed the noise is minimal and the trains did not run at night. The room was spacious and clean, the bed very comfortable. This hotel has won awards for architecture and design and is very modern, but blends well into the old-town charm of the "Gaslamp" area. Tons of excellent restaurants and nightclubs are within walking distance, as is Seaport Village and Horton Plaza for shopping. The Artesia Day Spa on-site was very good and my massage was adequate for stress-relief. Room service was fast and the food tasted great. As a Hilton Gold or Diamond member you get passes for a free full-buffet breakfast (including made-to-order omelettes). We will definitely be back for more sightseeing, great food and shopping, and another massage . An excellent (if somewhat pricey) choice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: brickbark
Reviews.Content: This is one of the trendiest hilton hotels I've been to. I wish they made more of them like this. It's a gorgeously appointed hotel. The rooms are large, and the special wing of the hotel (I can't think of the name if it of hand) is really nice. We had a huge jacuzzi tub that looked out into the bedroom. It was very romantic. It's convienently located in the gaslamp district, although I'd recommend renting a car if I were you, since San Diego is a city that can't merely be traversed on foot. Service was good at this hotel, as well. I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: AZWiseguy
Reviews.Content: My business partner and I were wowed by the service at the Gaslamp Hilton when we stayed. Every employee that we spoke to from housekeeping to management were courteous and eager to please. Another plus is that the hotel is very close to both the gaslamp restaurants, convention center, and the Trolley - prime location. Some things to consider if you want a room here: Parking can be extremely expensive everywhere in the Gaslamp - the area is deliberately not car-friendly. On a Saturday night, just use the hotel valet service. Be careful because they charge up to $30 a night - but the service is really nice if you take your car out all the time. Best bet is to be dropped off or find another way here and forget the car. The room furnishings are adequate, although people who pay over $200 a night may find themselves wanting better quality. Trains and Trolleys pass by the convention center side, but with windows closed it's not a big deal at night. I thought the bed was wonderful - I had trouble getting to my conference sessions :-) Service in the lobby restaurant is great, although the food is pretty basic fare. We thought it was a great place to stay, but our business footed the bill so it might be different if we payed out of pocket. I will say that I've never had a friendlier total hotel staff than the one at the Gaslamp Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect luxury”
Reviews.Author: free101girl
Reviews.Content: We paid over $450 per night for a one-bedroom suite at the Hilton Gaslamp because my husband and I keep very different hours and therefore prefer to have two rooms so one can go to bed early while other reads or watches TV. While there was nothing significantly wrong with the suite, it certainly wasn't worth the amount we paid. Essentially all we got for the money was some extra (empty) square footage and a bedroom door. The suite's furnishings were very middle-of-the-road standard-issue Hilton stuff. Not awful, but not particularly comfortable, and certainly not luxurious. The bedroom, while fairly good-sized, was furnished with only a king sized bed, two nightstands and an armoire containing an old, rather small television. The bedroom had plenty of space for at least a chair, or possibly even a love seat, but there was nowhere to sit down except on the bed. The living room was furnished with a love seat (hard/uncomfortable), one upholstered chair, a small desk and another armoire containing an old, smallish TV. While both armoires had a space for a minibar, neither actually contained a minibar. At this price point, I would expect a minibar, as well as a reasonable-sized flatscreen tv. Positives: the hotel's location is convenient to the Gaslamp area. The bed met the new Hilton standards and was very comfortable, with nice quality sheets and a duvet. The lobby bar servers were pleasant (though if the hotel wants to be "hip," as its literature claims it is, it needs to ditch the very unhip music in the bar!) The Hilton does have a "hotel within a hotel" called the Enclave, which sounds like it's trying to compete with W and similar hotels. We could have stayed there for only a little more money. Perhaps we should have. The problem is that the Enclave rooms, while large, are apparently all "loft style" (i.e. one continuous space) so that wouldn't have worked for our needs. We didn't hate this hotel, but it definitely didn't wow us in any way and we agreed that next time we'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Hilton! ”
Reviews.Author: dotSaltLakeCity
Reviews.Content: The Hilton San Diego Gaslamp is a wonderful hotel. The decor is modern and appears to have just been renovated. The property was extremely clean, the service was excellent; the valet service was exceptional. The pool side beds and chairs were very comfortable. We got a great deal via priceline and would highly recommend this hotel even at full price.

Reviews.Title: “Positive stay report”
Reviews.Author: joloje
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Friday night, in town to see Jet at the House of Blues. The room was on 8th floor, on the trolley/train track side. The noise is barely noticed if you shut the window. I slept good on the superior bed/bedding. HVAC unit was very quiet. No slamming door noise from hallway. No neighbor noise from adjoining rooms. The pool and spa area were clean and well-stocked with towels. Jacuzzi temp was hot, which I like. Restaurant food was not bad but service was poor. 30 bucks to park the car....more than some motel rooms! Overall enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would endorse. joloje

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Bed!!!”
Reviews.Author: MtzMama
Reviews.Content: A bed is the most important feature in a hotel for me. The bed at this hotel is awesome and brings the overall experience at the Gaslamp Hilton to the next level. The sheets are 100% cotton (feels like at least 300 thread) and the down comforter is covered (wrapped) between two sheets. Therefore, there is a clean, soft cotton sheet on the top of the comforter too, so you never have to touch any part of the bed that isn't brand new clean for you! The bed is a pillow-top and the mattress pad also has a pillow-top. Finally, there are five down pillows on a king size bed. The location of the hotel is great. We had dinner and drinks in the lively Gaslamp quarter; we walked to and from dinner and the bars. Petco Park is about 3 blocks away and we almost made it to a game. The area is very alive when the Padres are in town; also, with at least three universities around, the spring break night life was vibrant. The Gaslamp entertains a predominately young crowd, but we never felt out of place there. Every morning we ran down to the harbor from the Hilton and there is so much activity along the marina, with many shops and restauants. Again this area is not even a mile from the Hilton. The service at the Gaslamp Hilton was perfect. The staff was helpful with giving directions and gave great advice about restaurants and places to go. We had a great dinner at the Strip Club (steak house, not girls), and a wonderful breakfast at Club 222, both in the Gaslamp. I would definitely stay here again, but I would ask for a room far far far away from the train; I didn't think it would bother me, but it did. And, I will try to avoid the $30 per 24 hour garage, which we couldn't avoid one day. We have two children and would stay elsewhere with them, probably a resort style hotel in Mission Bay, but for my husband and I this was perfect and I toured a couple other 4 star hotels at the beach and the Hotel Del too. *Go on a Seal Tour, similar to Boston's Duck Tour: amphibious boat tour that lasts about one and a half hours, and takes you through downtown into the San Diego bay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great hotel experience!”
Reviews.Content: The is a great hotel. Location is fantastic, close to everything. The room was very nice, pool area and workout room is great. The closeness to the trolley station and transit is a plus. If you are in town for a Padres game this would be a great place to stay. There are a wide variety of restaurants within walking distance in the gaslamp area. The only down side of the hotel is the valet parking charge of $30 per day. I would recommend this hotel for a stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: larover
Reviews.Content: Living in LA I have been to San Diego many times. I have never stayed in The Gas Lamp District before as I thought it appeared to be too touristy. It probably is touristy but was alot of fun. The location of the hotel is right near a lively night life center catering to younger folks of college age but also has several very good restaurants that cater to middle aged folks. The restaurants in the area are pricey for what they are but not outrageous. If you have a car and want to eat at good more moderate restaurants where you are not paying so much for location drive up 5th avenue away from the hotel and the water until you come a few blocks to the end of 5th Avenue which would be University Avenue. There are many very good moderate restaurants over there. We stayed in the 5th Avenue Lofts part of the hotel which was different and fun. It had a modern feel and was not a typical hotel. The hotel is small and had the feel of a boutique hotel rather than a large Hilton which was great. Pool was very tasteful as were the seating areas and the gym was adequate. Room service was prompt and pretty good for a chain hotel. Staff was very polite and considerate. Our climate control was not working properly. They offered to move us which we declined as it was not a big deal but they did comp our breakfasts during our entire stay which was great of them. Also the room was not made up when we returned one day at 5pm. In response to our phone call they made it up immediately, apologized that the housekeepers were behind and sent us a complimentary cheese plate. Yes there is noise from the nearby trains. It did not bother us and did not seem to be a problem at night but one could request a quiet room. Hotel parking is very pricey and we parked at a garage a block away for half the price. Also from 6pm Sat through Mon morning you can park on the street without feeding the meter which we also did. The arm chair in the room was alittle worn but nothing major. The rest of the room was in very good shape. Coffee maker, free waters (not sure if this was because we are Hilton Club Members) and chocolates at night were a nice touch. The staff really went out of their way to make sure everything was in order. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visting San Diego and will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: newenglandfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed just 2 nights; room was delightful; the bed was incredibly comfortable; all the staff were courteous, readily avialable and very knowledgeble. The convention center is across the street but was quiet, so not sure how service would translate when the hotel is very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: hsmitty
Reviews.Content: I visit San Diego several times a year for business, but always try to include a few days of semi-pleasure while there. On my last trip in February, rather than my usual hotel in the business section, I decided to try the Hilton located in the up and coming gaslamp area. I am glad I did. This area has been 'revived over the past few years and in my opinion is more vibrant than the business section, yet it's not that far away, just a few minutes by car. The Hilton has a nice lobby, nothing fancy but quite open and utilitarian, with comfortable seating areas in the bar. The rooms are quite nice for the price, with enough character that I would consider staying here with my wife for a vacation on our way up the coast on my next visit. There are several nice restaurants very close to the hotel, including a few ethnic and sushi restaurants. Also, like the rest of downtown San Diego, it's very convenient to the airport. All in all, a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: muchuckles
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful! It has just been renovated and is very cute and trendy, yet still appropriate for a business traveler. It offers complimentary hardwire internet, HBO and 24-hour room service. I would highly recommend this property for its price, location and design.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hilton. Great Service”
Reviews.Author: mwm308
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Gaslamp for 2.5 weeks during a conference at the convention center in Feb (located across the street). The rooms have recently been updated and are very clean and nice looking. The convienence to the San Diego convention center is excellent. The service at the front desk and the bar is friendly and welcoming. Taxi service right outside was quick even at 5:00 am back to the airport. Because the hotel is located at the end of 4th and 5th street, you are in a perfect area to walk to all of the attractions in the Gaslamp quarters. I would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, very nice hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: LQGuy
Reviews.Content: Overall, we found this to be one of the better Hiltons we have stayed out. The location is pretty good, at the foot of Fifth Avenue and the edge of the Gaslamp (night-life and shopping area). There was a sleek, modern feel to the hotel. We found the staff to be helpful as well. Our room was exactly what we had requested! There were no signs of wear, bedding was comfortable and the bath was more than adequate with La Source toiletries. There are two complaints (one of which nothing can be done about): 1. Freight trains hitch up in front of the hotel. Being that it's downtown with lots of road crossings, they blow their horns a lot. Fortunately, they seem to be done by midnight. On our Saturday night stay, we did not hear them at all. 2. The hotel charges $30 per day to park your car! That's simply OUTRAGEOUS! Especially in light of there being $5/day lots around the corner for weekend parking (which is when we were there). But for those two inconveniences, everything else was perfect! And because it's almost impossible to get everything perfect, this hotel rates very high on our list of those to return back to in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay @ the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: LovetoTravel0479
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed several nights for the New Year. The location, hotel, and room was great! The Hilton is walking distance to restaurants and nightlife-no taxi needed. I must say, the bed at this Hilton is sooo soft and incredibly comfortable! The Hilton is remodeling their rooms coming Spring 2007. I'm excited to go back. I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: tootravel
Reviews.Content: nice place, close to convention center and gaslamp

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Loud Trains!”
Reviews.Author: pricelinefan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic. A hip, brand new hotel in the heart of downtown San Diego within a few blocks of some great restaurants and night clubs. The staff was cheerful, the room service was awesome, and the bed was comfy. My only complaint were the trains - the were extremely loud at 3 in the morning. $95/night on priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!! And a nice bed too”
Reviews.Author: gypsyjim79
Reviews.Content: My finance and I had a lovely 3 night stay over the Thanksgiving weekend in San Diego. After browsing hundreds of web pages and trying to decide on the perfect place to stay, I'm proud to report that I think I made a good decision, thanks to TripAdvisor! All of the postings regarding this property seem to be fair and factual. The location couldn't be better, just walking distance to more restaurants and nightlife than we had time to explore, and also a very short walk to San Diego Harbor. The bed at this Hilton is to die for, at times hard to get out of (at all times of the day). Other postings mention freight trains going through and blowing horns at all hours, honestly, the train horns were audible at some points during the day and evening, however I was never awakened or disturbed during the middle of the night (definitely sleep with the window closed!) Only complaint would be that they only have 27" tube televisions in the rooms and the remote was finicky. Staff was friendly and even helped us with finding the local airtime of "Grey's Anatomy" on Thanksgiving night. Would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place close to Petco”
Reviews.Author: Davidwatts
Reviews.Content: Excellent property. Nice outdoor pool, decent fitness room. Has new Hilton bed and bath linens which are great. Great location in the Gaslamp Quarter (the night life district), across the street from the convention center and two blocks from Petco Park. Close to a rail rapdi transit station.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL - the perfect location without a doubt”
Reviews.Author: xichic
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel, it is in the pefect location in the gaslamp quarter, close to all the great restaurants and next door to Petco stadium where we watched a baseball game. The Hilton service was top notch. We were upgraded to the executive level - the beds were incredibly comfortable and great selection on t.v. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel for breakfast, and it was delightful though a bit pricey. The hotel bar is great -- awesome drinks and great bartender. I recommend to book early because this hotel is located right across the street from the convention center and it is always booked! They did accomodate us though when we wanted to spend an extra night, but were unable to help us out during the week where a huge convention was taking place. Even when our air conditioner broke down for a few hours, the hotel staff responded immediately and even offered to change our rooms. Great hotel at a prime location, i would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: gnom:o)
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for 6 days to attend a conference. The convention centre was right across the street from the hotel which made it extremely convenient. Hotel staff were friendly & helpful. The room I had was comfortable with a king-size bed and adequate room & bathroom amenities. Only negative point is the train that runs by a couple of times at night- for some strange reason the driver sounds the horn loudly and that was very irritating. The hotel's location is perfect! I enjoyed exploring the Gaslamp Quarter and especially enjoyed the Horton Plaza Shopping Mall several blocks up the street from the hotel. Take a leisurely stroll along the MLK pathway right outside the hotel towards Embarcadero Marina Park North, Seaport Village, the USS Midway Aircraft Carrier Museum and the pier along North Harbor Drive. I could have walked on forever in that gorgeous weather!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: excursionplanner
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. It is located across the street from the Convention Center and at the edge of the Gaslamp Quarter. We felt very safe and comfortable walking through the Quarter and on to Horton Plaza. The trolley, which takes you everywhere in San Diego, has a stop right outside the hotel. The cost is only $1.25 for two hours, round trip... cheaper than parking in this city. Be prepared to pay $26.00 for valet parking at the hotel. The hotel is clean and nice looking. The staff are very friendly and helpful, especially the concierge. The parking staff are young, but well mannered, enough said. We requested a high floor and were given a room on the tenth floor. It had an excellent view of the city and a nice partial view of the bay. The room was nice, but simple. Nothing fancy here like you might expect from a four star hotel. No in room refrigerator. The bathroom is simple. No extras here, but it was clean. Ok, I enjoy snacking when at a hotel, but this one only offered a soda machine on our floor. The only snack machine was near the pool. No microwave, so don't bring the popcorn. Trains. This hotel is next to the trolley tracks and a railroad track. During the day, the hum of the trolley is quaint. At night, about four freight trains came through with whistles blowing all the way. We had our windows open for part of the night, but once they were closed I no longer heard the trains. However, my husband didn't sleep as well and still heard the trains throughout the night. The room was very quiet otherwise. Overall, it was a pleasant stay and we have no regrets. The view from our room and the friendly staff are what made it most enjoyable. We were celebrating our anniversary and I would have like a little more luxury, but it was fine for the price we paid on priceline. I would say it is a very nice three star hotel rather than a four star though. Local attractions tips: Almost all the attractions in San Diego have a web site... including the Gaslamp Quarter, Seaport Village and the USS Midway. Use a search engine and get information before visiting. The Gaslamp Quarter site has restaurant descriptions, prices and menus... very helpful. Tips: If you are a Hilton Hhonors member, you will not receive points when booking through a third party, such as priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Nice; really nice. Forget -- it was great!”
Reviews.Author: pktrib
Reviews.Content: For several years we've had a couple of friends urging us to visit San Diego -- we finally did and I'm looking forward to returning. If you're in SD you must stay in the Gaslamp Quarter and if you're in the Gaslamp Quarter do what you can to stay with Hilton. The hotel is clean, comfortable, you feel pampered -- I'm sorry for repeating myself, I already told you it was Hilton property and I believe that just comes with the name :) However, what this property has that the others don't is Seth. Seth is the concierge and does he know his stuff! I don't believe there's anything going on in SD, Tijuana or Coronado that he doesn't know about. Discount tickets for the zoo or a ballgame, see Seth. Dinner recommendations and reservations, see Seth. Considering a trip to Tijuana, Seth is your guy. So that I don't have you wondering if he's my nephew (smile) please let me say that everyone we encountered went above and beyond. The hotel is perfectly situated and once you get over the noise of the trolleys at night (or learn to close your windows) it's all good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: luke_in_vegas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location near the convention center and PETCO park in downtown San Diego. The only bad things are the occational train going by, small bathrooms, and $26 a day parking. I don't mind paying over $200 a night for a room, but there is no reason parking should be over $20, for that matter any cost at all. The overall service and quality of the hotel is great, but still not quite the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for downtown”
Reviews.Author: Daisuki
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is a good example of the brand's quality and service. The hotel is ideally situated for doing almost anything in San Diego. This is not a hotel on the beach or seaside- it is in the middle of downtown- but access to nightlife is particularly good, with all San Diego attractions within walking distance. The hotel is surprisingly quiet Parking will be a nightmare, but that's a problem with the Gaslamp area, not the hotel. The lobby was clean and inviting, the hotel staff courteous and professional. Our room was quite large, the Deluxe King, with a small sofa and its own balcony overlooking the pool. The bathroom was not large or that luxurious but was very clean and modern. As usual the bed was probably the best part about the room, extremely comfortable and sometimes hard to get out of. The fitness center was a bit cramped but adequate if you're just trying to get a quick workout in. The food and the room service were excellent but a little pricey, and there are better dinner choices within walking distance, however this hotel is a very good deal for the money. If you feel like splurging some night, call room service and have their creme brulee sent up to the room, it's a great way to end the day.

Reviews.Title: “Was Nice but Expensive.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my girlfriend during the 4th of July weekend this year. The room was expensive but I knew that going in. The parking was bad and ended up paying $26 to valet it at the hotel. We were on the 7th floor and could see the train tracks. I was worried that the train would keep us up but we didn't hear it the entrie time we were there. There was some rust on the wall near some of the hardware in the shower but other than that the room was nice. We didn't really hear anyone but we were out of our room most of the time. Overall it was nice but expensive. On a side note, decent food was hard to find after midnight, not the hotels faults just a heads up.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to Hilton Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: Esticat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a three night stay at the Hilton Gaslamp and can't imagine we could have been more happy anywhere else. From the moment we arrived the staff treated us as special guests, and made us feel like we were staying with family. The bed was so comfortable, the room impecabbly clean, and fresh thick ribbed towels provided daily in our bathroom. The dog park next door was a wonderful asset, if you're a dog lover. The location was perfect and the entire Gaslamp district is walkable from this property, where great food, shopping and entertainment can be found. We took the fairy over to Coronado Island and recommend doing so as well. When we return to beautiful San Diego we will most definitely choose the San Diego Hilton Gaslamp for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Angie2117
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 8 month old son, and myself stayed at the Gaslamp Hilton for close to a week on vacation. Again, Hilton exceeded our expectations with this stay. Everyone in the hotel was great with our son, upgraded our room when a different one become available, and always happily met any request we asked for all week. The hotel is in a great location, and the staff was very helpful in giving ideas of places to eat, visit, etc. Because parking was only valet and more expensive at the hotel, they provided other options for us, which was about $12/day. We would definitely stay there again and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The best, still the best”
Reviews.Author: TmanSydney_Australia
Reviews.Content: It truly is the best place to stay. My family spend three nights here and we really enjoyed ourselves. The room was neat, modern and well appointed. The location is excellent, litererily up the street to lots of restaurants, bars and shops.All this 'good stuff' is complimented by the best staff we have come accross in the US. Polite, friendly and knowledgable of their city. The conceirge was simply outstanding, but the bell staff, desk and valet were all excellent. Stay here and only here in San Diego. Don't worry about the proximity to the attractions like Sea World, it's less than 10 minutes away in the car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Managable Hotel in Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: jakester20
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the hotel during a conference that was held at the convention center across the street. It was a very nice stay. Yes, if you are very sensitive to noise you may be bothered by the freight trains. However, they provide some terrific white noise; essentially no different that staying on highway interchange, on waterfront, etc. The trains did not come close to affecting my stay; in fact made it more charming The hotel had several very nice features. First, it's right at the foot of the Gaslamp District in a truly great location. Everything is within a short walk. Second, it was very small; almost a boutique hotel; not your parents Hilton. Third, there's FREE high speed internet. Sure, you may be paying for it in your rate, but not as an add on. Last, it's virtually brand new. The staff is fine and everybody is very pleasant. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Gaslamp great conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbcreg
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is directly across from the conventions center for easy access, within easy walking distance of all kinds of food, right next to the trolley and a short walk from Seaport Village. Great location. All services were handled professionally and food in restaurant was competetively priced compared to other restaurants in area. Clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gaslamp Hilton for five nights while attending a conference at the convention center. I always enjoy staying at the smaller hotels during conventions rather than staying at the main conference hotel. The Hilton did not disappoint me. I had a king room on the 6th floor looking toward the Gaslamp District. Very nice bed and bedding, and a nice bathroom. The hotel staff was always very nice. They always keep apples at the front counter and it was nice to grab an apple on my way out of the hotel each morning. There is a park outside the front door of the hotel where many locals bring their dogs to play- if you miss your dogs they are always glad to let you pet theirs. Two blocks from Petco Park. The area was not noisy, even after a Padres game. Plenty of things to do and places to eat within the Gaslamp District. PJ's next door has coffee, rolls and sandwiches for breakfast. Marble Slab Creamery is just a half a block further for a late night snack. The trolley runs right outside the hotel - we took it to Old Town and it also goes to Tijuana. You can walk to Sea Port Village and the Harbor in minutes. If you're looking for the fancy hotel with lots of pools, fountains and tennis courts (more like Vegas), stay at the Marriott or Hyatt. If you like a cozy more personal hotel, this Hilton is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Know what you're getting”
Reviews.Author: waynelaw78
Reviews.Content: Satyed Feb. 22-26, 2006 PROS: Excellent location; all services (valet, room service, housekeeping, front desk) were excellent. Room was clean, stylish, and well-furnished. Towels and bedding were great (except no fitted sheets, a pet peeve for my wife). Very quiet in Enclave section. CONS: Enclave is inconvenient to get to. You must take two elevators and cross an outdoor terrace. No special amenities for being in the Enclave. For $60 more per night, should get a reception or breakfast. Website pictures are not typical of Enclave rooms. Ours was very small, with a very small bathroom and tub. I would stay again, but would book the Executive floor if I wanted to spend a little extra. I felt like I got nothing for my extra cost this time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, housekeeping not tops”
Reviews.Author: JulieMeyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Gaslamp for nearly 3 weeks while on a business trip. Overall, this was a good hotel. I was however disappointed by housekeeping. The second day of my trip, I dropped some cake crumbs on the carpet and they were still there when I left. It's not that they were somewhere hidden in a corner, but really in plain sight. The bathroom was always cleaned, but I didn't always get replacements for the towels that were taken away. The Fitness Center is a little bit small and generally crowded in the morning, but at least it's free. Only 3 treadmills! The location is great, the hotel is right at the edge of the Gaslamp Quarter and opposite the convention center. During large conventions, it tends to get really crowded and very noisy. There are huge gaps under the door, so ask for a corner room which is nowhere close to the elevator and less people walk by. If you are a light sleeper, be aware that the train tracks cross right in front of the hotel, and there are frequent cargo trains during the night, always honking (I never understood why they need to honk at 3am). Staff at reception was generally helpful. I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bibescu
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel situated in the heart of San Diego, minus the traffic and noise. I spent here 2 nights and I really enjoyed it. My room, at the 8th floor, was clean, large and well furnished. The bed was comfortable and the bedding first quality. I did not eat in the hotel, so I can't speak about the food, too many great choices near by. The staff was friendly and helpful. This is a very nice hotel and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: helr
Reviews.Content: Great position for exploring San Diego. We combined it with a stay in the Mission Bay area. Ignore the comments about not taking children - the hotel was very kid-friendly, concierges helpful etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of all the action!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading through all the reviews on this hotel, I was skeptical. My husband and I spent one night at the Hilton and wished we had stayed more!! The location cannot be beat - right next to all the action of the Gaslamp but far enough away to not be loud. We were there the weekend of the Padres and Chargers playing at home and had no problems with noise. My only slight complaint is that the concierge was less than helpful in finding great places to eat. Fortunately, we are adventurous and just wandered around until we found something - and we had tons of choices!!! I would definitely stay here again in the future!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vagabond23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have traveled to San Diego many, many times and usually stay at the beach. We decided this time we would try something different. We found this hotel on priceline and only paid $100 a night for this hotel. It is tough to argue with the location or decor of this hotel. The area is great, the lobby is modern and elegant and the rooms are nicely appointed and very comfortable. We had a king room and found it was good sized and the bathroom was large. The only problem was that you could hear everything from the hallway in the room. It was so bad that the second night my husband shoved an extra blanket under the door so that the sound would be muffled a bit. I was surprised to hear that others did not find the staff to be rude. I stood at the front desk for almost five minutes, alone, waiting to check-in while the staff talked between themselves. We were given a very nice room, and the bar tender was very nice when we went down for a drink in the evening. However, the next morning I went to the front desk looking for a newspaper and the man there told me to go across the street while an entire stack of newspapers sat next to him! I couldn't believe it. The whole feeling of the hotel is very snotty, and although the building is gorgeous, the people and service left a lot to be desired. For the price, given the San Diego market, it still is a good deal, but we did not have a very good feeling the time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Trust me, EXCELLENT HOTEL... for adults”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: I booked through Priceline; though I was excited when I was that this was the #3 hotel in San Diego, I was worried after I read the reviews from Summer 2005. Well for $100 per night I figured it couldn't be that bad.... I was wrong, it was great! Every complaint that I read here was COMPLETELY unfounded. Let me go through the stuff and give you my VERY critical opinion. 1. Innovative design and helpful friendly service 2. Front desk was professional and responsive 3. Bar/lounge service was very cool... fireplaces, TV’s and couches... the bartender IS a joke... yes he sucked, the only bad part of the experience. 4. Security was all over, they even made sweeps through the halls 5. The halls are boring... and??? 6. Everything in our room was impeccably clean, carpet, bathroom, windows... everything. 7. The bed was hands down, no fooling, the most comfortable I’ve ever had in a hotel room. Down pillow top mattress, down comforter, and 6... yes I said 6 down pillows. I'm telling you I cannot sleep in a cheap uncomfortable bed... this one was heaven. I have the perfect bed at home, I gotta tell you this one was better. *Room service ends at 11pm... that's true. Good thing there is over 100 HUNDRED restaurants within walking distance. * Everything was fresh and new... this thing was built in 2001! * The restaurant was packed. The food is great. I waited 20 minutes from order to food, Saturday, during a convention. * When I was there the hotel WAS busy... it's across the street from the convention center I'm thinking this hotel is busy all the time. *Not a resort enviroment, think industrial/urban chic. *This is NOT, NOT, NOT a kid’s hotel… nothing about the gas lamp district is for kids really… Stay in Mission Bay, somewhere adjacent to Sea World if you want kiddyland… What do clubs, bars and high end restaurants have to do with children anyway? DOWNTOWN FINANCIAL/CONVENTION DICTRICT = ADULT ----> Please parents, let's keep it that way. Would I pay $200 - $300 for this room??? Hmmm… now THAT is a good question :>)

Reviews.Title: “Steps from the action, but only a fair hotel”
Reviews.Author: maroulni
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel, steps from the dining and nightlife options of the Gaslamp district. Hotel was on the smaller side (a plus), and had an intimate feel. As others have mentioned, parking fees sting, at $24 a day, plus tips. Bedding was extremely comfortable, but rooms were a little on the small side (we had a queen, not king room). You could hear every breath on the other side of the door to the room, which given the hotel's proximity to bars, meant several middle of the night awakenings by drunk guests. We stayed at the hotel with our toddler, and though we had called to specifically request a crib, the front desk had no record of our request, and was out of cribs. It took well over an hour for them to track down a crib for us, and in the meantime we had a very crabby baby. We got our reservation for this hotel through Priceline ($102 a night over Labor Day weekend), which was a steal. I would return for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Would like to go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly!! They gave us directions to various places and beaches. There are tons of resturants within walking distance. We didn't get a nice view but the rooms were clean. There is a overnight parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “You can tell the management /ownership has changed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times in the past and have followed it on trip advisor because I enjoyed it so much. However, the last few times I felt and saw a notable change. When I asked a staff member, I was told the hotel had been sold in the last year and the new owner had brought in a new management company and the management staff who had driven the quality of the hotel have all left. What a shame!!. You would think, eventually these hotel companys would understand that the paying public will put in a few extra dollars to keep the amenities up to par, and that the overall profit will come from loyal customers coming back, not having first time guests come and go to never return.

Reviews.Title: “What happened to this great hotel?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I live in LA county and travel to San Diego regularly for both recreation and for business. I have stayed at this hotel before, averaging maybe 3 times per year for the last few years. As a loyal customer, I want to know what happened to this great hotel? I can't believe the change since I last stayed there about a year ago. The staff is frazzled, the hotel seems frayed at the edges and the service is no longer friendly or attentive. Let me give you a few examples: * I tried to get room service delivered the first night I got there, only to be told they no longer had 24-hour room service, but it had closed at 11. I got told "maybe you should order a pizza" by the front desk staff and they offered me the number of the place they call at night when they are hungry. A real 4-star performance. * My room was not the fresh experience I remembered from before. Although the high-speed internet worked well, it seemed like the carpet was dirty and the bathroom floor hadn't been cleaned. * This hotel used to feel like a haven, but it was crowded with people, hectic and I felt generally ignored by the staff. Usually, people say hi to me as I walk in the lobby. I think the staff barely had time to breathe the day I was there--why don't they just put on more staff? * The restaurant was a packed madhouse. Food took over 40 minutes to arrive. The waiter told me all the staff had quit and the supervisor called in sick. Is this place running itself? I don't know what's happened there, but it used to be such a nice place. One member of the staff told me they were under new management. Maybe that's what has happened. I don't know who's running the place now, but they could take lessons from how it used to be. I won't ever stay there again...in fact, I'm going back to San Diego in September and I'm staying at the Solamar. My wife's boss suggested we try that hotel because he loved his visit there in May. Goodbye Hilton...once and for all!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: kristimae
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Gaslamp for a recent conference I attended. The location was perfect, as it is right across the street from the conference center. The rooms were nice, clean and fairly good sized. The beds were extremely comfortable. I will have to agree with the person that wrote about the large gaps under the doors however I did not hear anyone else, I didn't feel there was excessive noise. The fitness center had several options for working out (very few weights, but several cardio machines). The lobby areas were very nice and comfortable. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The only negative I can think of was the breakfast buffet. It is $15.95 plus tax and not worth that much at all. Poor food choices but it was quicker than ordering off the menu. The restaurant staff seemed overwhelmed and often forgot things that we had asked for and we repeatedly had to ask for our check. My advice a nice hotel to stay in, just avoid the restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “WHAT FAMILIES NEED TO KNOW ABOUT GASLAMP HILTON”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of three just returned from a 6 night vacation in San Diego, and we stayed at the GasLamp Hilton from 07/17-07/23/05. I booked my trip through Priceline and got a rate of $125.00. I thought that was a fair price and good deal since I saw this hotel was voted "BEST OF WEB IN 2004". Once I arrived my opinion changed completely.Upon check-in the front desk informed me that since I booked on priceline I would not receive any Hilton Honor points or credits for my stay. I asked about upgrading my room to stay in the Enclave Towers. I was informed that the Enclave Towers is treated as a seperate hotel and if I wanted to stay there I would have to forego the $875.00 I had already paid to priceline and for $229.00 per night I could stay at the Enclave. I AM NOT MAKING THIS UP! In addition if you go to the Hilton main web page, they are advertising a special for families staying with them this summer, where they give families approximately eight coupons and discounts for staying with them. When I inquired about this program,the GasLamp Hilton didn't have a clue what I was referring to. When I directed them to their corporate web site, and again inquired the next day, they gave me four or five brouchures about San Diego I could have picked up anywhere. The room I was assigned was a very basic, small room,small bath nothing special,with a view of a building rooftop. The pool was especially small and so was the hottub. Parking was $24.00 per night and the breakfast buffet was $15.00 per person.The hotel had absolutely no activities for kids,no gameroom no movies, nothing. I enjoyed my visit to San Diego,but I will never stay in the GasLamp Hilton again. It is the least family friendly hotel I have ever stayed in and my family and I travel with my ten year old son every year. This is the first review I have ever written but I felt compelled to write because I use tripadvisor to help make my decisions on where to stay and this time I believe they fell flat. Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “What is all the Hype about this Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: David in Manchester
Reviews.Content: I have to say that after all I had read in Guide Books and on the Internet about this Hotel I was pretty disappointed. There is nothing particularly bad about it but it just didn’t live up to expectation. The location isn’t bad – just on the edge of the Gas Lamp District - but because of the Convention Center there is no sea view – in fact no view at all to speak of. The rooms were adequate but by no means grand although I did have to complain about a blocked sink twice before it was fixed. The other thing I didn’t like was that there were pretty big gaps under the room doors (why?) and one aftrenoon whilst waliking down the corridor I could hear quite clealy a couple making out which I really didn’t need. Not much privacy. The staff are pleasant and helpful – especially the Consierge who gave us lots of good advice about things to do, how to get to places etc. Despite the above I wouldn’t stay there again as I think the location isn’t particualrly great and for what it is I feel it is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, room average to above average.”
Reviews.Author: Bernfive
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, room average to above average. Stayed for the July Fourth weekend. Got a good deal on priceline for $83 for two rooms. Price aside, you are in the heart of the Gaslamp district, excellent if you want to experience the nightlife or a Padres game. Petco is only 3 short blocks away, although I didn't attend a game. The rooms themselves are fairly standard for what you would expect from a 3 or 4 star hotel. The beds were excellent, but the size of the rooms and bathroom are what you what you would expect from a inner city hotel. Standard size. Hotel is on the "hip" side with their furnishings and artwork. Lobby is nice, didn't really interact with the staff although the maid was thankful for the tip we left. I appreciate when the maid is thankful for tips you leave. Valet was good, although keep in mind that parking is $24 a day. An alternative after you've dropped off your belongings is to park at the 6th Avenue Parkade which services the ballpark. Its two short blocks away. Its city owned and its $13 a day, although you don't have in and out priviledges and if there's a game on you have to pay $10 event fee. We missed going in during game times so I don't know if its more if you leave it overnight. They do at night have $1 per hour charge with a $6 maximum and its a little convoluted after that but it was only $13 and $8 the two times we left it overnight there. Best to search the Gaslamp district site and call the parking garage if you are thinking of parking there. Didn't have any problems with the trains which pass by about 40 feet from the hotel.
