The trolleys make little noise but the freight trains make noise but it didn't wake me. Noise from the hallway was much more distracting which was considerably louder. (think people coming back from the nightlife from Gaslamp) Hotel is also about 300 feet from the convention center and about 6 blocks to Seaport village, which heightens its location rating. Overall, good for people looking to experience nightlife and seaport village but probably not good for kids.

Reviews.Title: “great beds, poor front desk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the best bed i ever slept in. had reservations for five rooms, when we arrived, only had four. whoever took reservation put the fifth one for the night before. would not accomodate us, two people had to share one room. unbelievable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hilton - Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: wslaughter
Reviews.Content: Unmistakably, above average for a Hilton Hotel. Highly attentive staff, splendid rooms, and the best location of any hotel in the city if being in the middle of things is what you seek. While the pool is tiny by most standards, it is nice. Yes, you're paying a premium for location, but there are ample other plusses associated with this property. You'll pay for them, but enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 1 friday night and was very pleased. I was there with my Girlfriend and daughter. The lobby was clean and the staff was very friendly that I ran into. People that comment on the parking in San Diego, it is like that evry where you go in San Diego so expect to pay $20-$30 a night. I scored with the price I got from Priceline ($85.00 + taxes).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: carlag
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice facility, and we had a very nice room with two double beds overlooking the pool. My husband was there for a conference, with the convention center across the street, and it is a nice hotel for business travelers. We brought our two young children along, however, and it was a difficult place to stay with them. For one, the windows opened in a peculiar way, and we were on the seventh floor overlooking the pool. Needless to say, if I tried to prop open the windows, my two-year old immediately thought it would be fun to drop things from the window into the pool -yikes! The room was very quiet, with the exception of the trains running by directly adjacent to the hotel at all times of the night. Luckily my kids thought it was fun to watch the trains, though if not for that, it might have been annoying. The hotel is within walking distance of Seaport Village which is nice. It also has easy access to many shops and restaurants, and several freeways for access to greater San Diego. The pool was a bit small, but was nice nonetheless. We were at the pool several times and never caught site of another child. We ordered room service multiple times - the food was a bit disappointing for the cost. I would stay there again if I needed to be in the area. Not the best place for kids, however, especially when there are numerous suite-type hotels for reasonable costs that cater to families. We moved to the Staybridge Suites on our third night and it was so much more comfortable for our family. The Hilton is nice, though!

Reviews.Title: “A delightful & most comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Valjf5
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from staying at the Gaslamp Hilton Hotel, choosing it after reading the feedback on Tripadvisor. The Suite we occupied was smartly furnished and with the most comfortable bed you could ask for, with views over San Diego in two directions. The large bathroom only had a walk in shower ( no bath) but this was no problem for us as the shower was large and powerfull and our preference anyway. Good tea/coffee making facilities and no noise problems from other bedrooms/corridor/Streets (with windows closed) although heard the odd train. As mentioned in others feedback, the location was absolutely perfect for the Gaslamp District with its numerous Restaurants and Bars in surrounding Streets (Shopping Mall only about 8 minutes walk). Courteous and fast Valet service for the car, expensive but because of the location and limited parking in the area, acceptable. Only had breakfast in the Hotel during our stay. The food excellent,but service a bit on the slow side although very friendly. A great bonus was the "FREE" Office facility off the main Lobby which had two PCs with Broadband internet access/printer/stationary and every office item you could want provided ie: pens/stapler/pencils/scissors/paper etc etc Also an ATM terminal. Saw the swimming pool and Terrace which looked very nice but regretfully time did not allow us to try it! We would definately return to this Hotel again if in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “What a Mess!”
Reviews.Author: billyar
Reviews.Content: I travel often and am a Hilton Gold HHonors member for many years. I know hotels well and this hotel is a total failure when it comes to service. I had to wait for a room to be readied despite arriving after 4 p.m, then was given a small Queen room instead of the King I booked. When I called the desk no one answered. So, check in was bad. The room lacked many advertised amenities. No Robe, no Frette linens. The continental breakfast featured unripe and unedible fruit. White bread was the only option and was too big for the small toaster. Juice was not fresh. The "Executive" level is worthless. No one answered when room service was called. Eventually the front desk picked up and took my order. Needless to say, it was lost. When we finally did get our food, much later, the chef brought it up as they were understaffed. He did not know how to serve and forgot improtant items. The food was awful, not suprising as the Chef is delivering food. I called the front desk after the room service trouble, they said the manager would be in touch the next morning. He never called. No one answers the phones here. The morning paper never arrived. When I went to the Front Desk the next day to get change to tip the valet they had none! 11 a.m. on a workday and the Hotel cant even break a $20.00. This Hotel failed from check in to check out. This would be a bad experience for anyone. Being of a frequent guest of Hilton Hotels it was twice as frustrating for me. Almost every staff member I spoke too said they were "slammed" or "understaffed." I checked out early and moved to the absolutly excellent Omni next door. I have stayed at many Hiltons over the years and this is one of the worst based on price for value. By the way, I wrote the manager a letter of complaint and never got a response. Not a surprise really. There are many better hotels in this higher price range in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of this property is superb, within walking distance to the Gaslamp Quarter but not noisy at all. Also right next to the Convention Center. When I walked in to the hotel, I thought it was brand new. Maybe it is. Everything about my stay was excellent, including the room and the service. My room had a small balcony, but my friend's room had a window. The bed was comfortable. I was pleased to get this room for $75 on priceline vs. the quoted rate of $199. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved the location! Once we left the car, we never needed it again until we checked out! (BTW: Valet Parking only.) I was concerned when we booked the dates about the location, because of a Padres game was scheduled. The hotel is within walking distance from the stadium and across the street from the Convention Center. It didn't affect us at all, because the crowds were on the other side of the streets and traffic was controlled with cones and police officers. Our room was clean. Loved the decor. There was no fridge for those extra snacks purchased at the local stores. Nightlife was fun! The concierge suggested great places to eat and drink! The front desk was very friendly as well as the valet service. Check out was a breeze and so was collecting the car! Never had to wait for anything! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a loft in the "Enclave Tower" in August of 2003. The room was incredible and very posh. The location of the Hilton is unbeatable. It is easy to walk everywhere in the Gaslamp District. It was a big splurge for us to stay in a loft. The gym was very well-equipped and had a very nice view of the pool. The only problems we had at the Hilton were the uncontrollable children running wild (obviously, that's the parents' fault, not the hotel's) and the high level of noise from our room. They need better sound deadening for this price range. (I take earplugs for all of my hotel visits. They didn't help at all this time.) When I mentioned it at checkout, the desk clerks were indifferent at best. We are trying the Hilton again in July. The sound problems were certainly not enough to keep us away. This hotel is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Brown-2004
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers have pretty much said it all. We stayed for three nights in February and loved it. The staff are exceptionally helful, courteous and knowledgable. Our room was immaculate with a great view. The pool was heated just right and the large king size chaises were to die for. Top it all off with the super location and no less than 75 restaurants you can walk to and the Horton plaza, Seaport Village and the ferry to Coronado and you have all the makings of a wonderful holiday or business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: TrueConfessions
Reviews.Content: The room was OK, nothing special, but very clean and nicely decorated in a minimalist style with muted neutral colors. However, it had problems: One of the rods used to open and close the curtains broke off in my hand; a sizeable metal wall panel (about 4-foot high by 1.5 foot wide) covering some electrical outlets in the wall was held up by a floor lamp and fell on the floor when the lamp was moved. I stayed for two nights. On day two, the maid apparently came in while I was out, threw some clean towels on the unmade bed, and left the room untouched: didn't make the bed, didn't take away the soiled towels on the floor in the bathroom, didn't empty the brimming trash can, didn't re-stock the coffee supplies - in short, didn't do a gosh-darned thing. I was really surprised - I called down to the front desk and had the situation remedied, but no one was the least bit apologetic. That night, the room service pizza tasted like Ragu on toast. Finally, when I left the hotel, the $24-a-day valet stood by while I trundled my bags into the trunk of my car. I've never had (non)service like this at any hotel in my life - not even as a starving student when the best I could afford was a Motel 6. I'm not a demanding guest and didn't spend much time in the room, so I can't fathom why I had such a bad experience. I just know I'll never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hit by the rain”
Reviews.Author: simonharris
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from a two night trip to San Diego and was booked in at the Hilton Gaslamp.When i arrived direct from the airport having come in from the UK via New York i was told that because of the heavy rain they had in the last few days some of the rooms were out of action. How rain could have put some of the rooms aout of action i have no idea! I was told they could not put me up that night but had booked me into the Marriott which was just around the corner. The Marriott was fantastic. I went back to the Hilton the next morning as arranged and left my bag as i had to go off to a meeting. Arriving back later was given my room and was told they had upgraded me to a one bed suite. The room was nice and roomy but the decor looked a little "tired". The staff were helpful and apologetic about the problems. Would i stay again: great location and ok rooms ( ok i was spoilt at the Marriott) better than may an hotel in San Diego and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Sad to leave”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 2 Whilpool baths per day. perfect night sleep every night even down town. The enclave on the 4th floor was something that i wish my father could see me in. The dacor reminds me of his generations idea of the good life. That rat pack generation of lighting and beautiful sharp cornered furniture. I had to have a martini in the room. The bathroom was just the perfect size for 2 people to use perfectly. It is as if you had another hotel room just in the bathroom. I can tell you that the few dollars that you spend there is made up in service, service service. I wish that they would clear out the fridge with their beers and let us decide what we need for food and drinks. We still ordered room service and we still drank their water but we had no room for our cheese and crackers and wine that we bought around the area's stores.

Reviews.Title: “We would love to go back”
Reviews.Author: YLMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gaslamp Hilton for a couple days after Christmas (12/29-12/31/2004) We chose a room in the Enclave based on reviews I read here. We didn't get the jacuzzi tub which I thought they all came with and while it wasn't anything spectacular it was very large and the high ceiling made it seem larger. I am a person who happens to like Hilton hotels because they are consistent in providing all the necessities and little things like mouthwash, lots of towels, clean bathrooms and comfortable beds go a long way to making me happy. I thought the terry cloth robes were a nice extra too. The real beauty of this hotel though is it's location. We parked our car on Wed when we checked in and didn't drive it again until Friday when we checked out. We walked and took the trolley everywhere we went during our stay. We did end up eating breakfast at the Hilton one morning, because for all the Gaslamp district's charm it is very lacking in good places to have breakfast. We walked to one restaurant and after finding out it was a 45 min wait walked back to the Hilton and had the breakfast buffet. It wasn't spectacular but it worked. We paid extra to be in the enclave and I don't know if it was worth the extra money, but my husband loved it. He especially liked the high ceiling in the room. We plan to go back this summer and attend a baseball game. You can walk to Petco park from the Gaslamp. Pros: Location, clean room, comfortable bed, good service, nice staff Cons: Can't really think of any.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Jake2U
Reviews.Content: Stayed here between Christmas and New Year's in a (corner) 10th floor Executive Suite with whirlpool tub. Very comfortable bed. Zoned heating. Very unique Hilton with European boutique atmosphere and decor. Classy, expensive furnishings. Extremely comfortable bed. No street sounds. No sounds from other rooms. Free Internet and printers. Super friendly staff. Very professional and helpful concierge (give her a "10" for service). 5-star steakhouse across the street (Flemings). Wife loved security feature on elevators (they won't run unless you insert your room card). Big screen TV and fireplace adjacent to lounge. New Leaf restaurant was small, uncrowded, with an unimpressive menu. Skip it. But it doesn't matter because you're in the heart of the Gaslamp restaurant district. Valet parking very efficient, but next trip I'll use a public parking garage one block away next to the Old Spaghetti Factory restaurant. PJ's coffee shop also does breakfast sandwiches. Full service salon. Also recommend Lou & Mickey's steaks and seafood (not owned by Hilton, but in the same complex). Room rates fluctuate; you can get a great deal if you check Internet frequently. Wife stays free with HHonors program. Bottom Line: Do yourself a favor. This is the place to stay in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: somebody_else
Reviews.Content: Based on Tripadvisor reviews, we chose the Hilton Gaslamp for all 3 nights of our San Diego trip. I was told when I booked that if I left early, I'd have to pay 50% of each remaining room night. I'd never heard such a thing, and later, having seen amazing reviews of the Hotel Estancia in La Jolla (I'll be reviewing that also), decided to reduce my reservation at Hilton Gaslamp to 1 night and book 2 nights at Estancia. Thank goodness. The location is convenient to the Gaslamp area, and right near a trolley stop. The decor is really nice and stylishly minimalist, yet light and airy. The bed was comfortable, and a man at the front desk recommended a great Mexican restaurant on Coronado (Miguel's Cocina, if you're interested), for which we were very grateful. Other than that, we had some definite problems. 1) I requested turndown (they asked what time, I said before 7, no problem, ma'am). Never showed up. 2) I asked for a feather pillow, but they said they were all out (okay, I admit this is a small thing) 3) We showed up at the executive lounge for breakfast about 10 minutes after the official opening time. The hostess had CNN blasting from the TV while she worked with the door open, so loudly we could hear it from the elevators, despite the fact there must be some people still asleep at 6:10am. The hostess was making a terrible racket, tossing cutlery into cutlery drawers, and clanging cups and bowls onto the shelves. She looked at us and continued at it. I said good morning to her, and then after a few seconds, she replied. After that, she didn't say a word to us, just kept loading and unloading extremely loud tableware and juice bottles not more than a few feet away from us. - it was like we were eating next to a metal/glass recycling truck. I didn't notice her greet subsequent guests, either. Evidently she wasn't happy in her work. 4) I was lucky to get a bath in the evening, because from the late evening onwards, there was absolutely no hot water. When we checked out at 1PM, my husband still hadn't been able to take a shower -Worst of all, when my husband called to inquire about the hot water, and later when we checked out, there was no concern or apology on the part of the staff for the lack of hot water. 5) While my husband was checking us out, I started to roll out the luggage to the car. Two valets stood there and watched me roll the luggage (1 trip for each piece) from the lobby, then just as my husband arrived, stepped forward to help. Not that I couldn't handle the luggage, but an earlier offer would have been standard at other hotels. I guess what I'm trying to say is, each of these factors in itself might not be enough to keep me away from the hotel, but taken together, I think I'd rather go back to the Estancia, or try someplace new. Perhaps conference organizers have a different experience?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jon Deaux
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Gaslamp Quarter Hotel for a short Thanksgiving vacation. The hotel was a short and easy drive from the airport. We had a late check-in and the clerk advised us of the amenities we were entitled to. Unfortunately, the conceierge lounge was closed for remodeling, something the clerk was apparently not aware of since he made a point of telling us where it was located and the hours of operation. After looking for the lounge the next AM and not being able to find it, a call to the front desk revealed that the lounge was closed for remodeling, and the lounge amenities were moved to the restaurant on the lobby level. The restaurant was very small, and had a limited breakfast menu for those not desiring the continental breakfast. A breakfast buffet was listed on the menu as an available option, but was not available during our stay. The only buffet available for breakfast was the continental breakfast, which was not for those individuals on low carb diets. Fortunately, there is a great variety of restaurants located within close proximity to the hotel with almost any type of cuisine you want. The hotel is conveniently located with easy access either by car or by foot to many of the local attractions in San Diego. Our room was clean by most hotel standards, and a definite plus was the availability of free high speed internet access in the rooms, as well as two computers in the business center with printers for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews here and elsewhere online, I stayed at the Enclave for three nights last week. Con - My room was somewhat small, and did not have a loft ceiling or a jacuzzi tub. When I inquired about this, I was told that these are only found in one of the six suites, not in most of the other Enclave rooms. I believe there are 30 total. Other than a bath robe, the amenities were standard-issue, not luxury. The only mirror was in the bathroom. Pro - The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Lovely locatoin. Great sized rooms. Friendly staff. We had Thanksgiving lunch there. Nice, but not worth $212. Opposite the convention center. Great views from high floors. Modern hotel built in 2000. 10 minute walk from Horton Plaza. Pleasant walk up to Balboa Park. The room was nice. Spacious room. Pretty clean, but at one point during our stay, i can genuinly say from the bottom of my heart that there was more trash on the floor of the hotel than there was on the street. Yeah...I know! But, it wasn't a huge deal. The concierge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Gaslamp Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The entire sales staff and concierge did a great job of making sure that my meeting was productive and memorable. Anything we needed to change in our meetings, they were very accomodating and responsive. The concierge was extremely knowledgable and helpful in restraunts, golf courses and nightlife in the Gaslamp district. The rooms create a relaxing atmoshpere and he bar is great to hang out in before a Padres game. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to experience San Diego the right way.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The positives...Pleasant front desk staff, exceptional housekeeping service, nice decor, good sized room, great location for the Convention Center and Gaslamp District (if you're into that scene), and across the street from a Flemming's Steak House (yum). The negatives...kind of slow service in the hotel restaurant, average food, no self park (add $21/day for valet parking not including tips), and the Gaslamp District (if you're NOT into that scene). Overall, it was nice enough.

Reviews.Title: “Not a five or four star hotel, it is after all just a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Other reviews make the hotel sound like a five star resort. It isn't. It is just a Hilton that is relatively new and in good shape. When we checked in we were given the keys to the wrong room. Went back to the front desk and there was no apology for their mistake or our inconvenience. Glasses in the room were dirty. Toothpaste from the last guest on the faucet. Toilet very difficult to flush. Walls and doors are thin. Quite a bit of noise from the hallway and could hear the person in the next room on the phone and could understand the conversation. On the good side the location is good, plenty of places nearby to walk to. View from the room was also nice. Fine as a basic hotel but nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: 4fourtheroad
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of reviews on Tripadvisor. Got a great rate for a king executive room on the top floor, which included a daily continental breakfast. Rooms are nicely furnished with Frette linens. Staff were all friendly, helpful and efficient. Concierge helped with dinner reservations and directions. The location is fantastic, right at the entrance to the Gaslamp quarter, next to the trolly line that can take you all over San Diego, and an easy walk to Seaport Village and the waterfront. We've stayed at the Hyatt and Marriott before, and they are very nice, but for price and amenities, the Hilton Gaslamp can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great San Diego Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Gaslamp in San Diego is the perfect hotel to suit all of my business needs. This property is conviently located in the heart of San Diego and is accessible to many dining choices, along with businesses and the convention center. The staff has always been friendly and accomodating and have gone out of their way to make my stay enjoyable. I am currently working with the sales staff on a possible regional meeting site and have been very pleased with the efforts of the sales team in that regard. The rates are reasonable and again the staff has met and exceeded my expectations with all of my requests. I am confident we will have a successful meeting at the Gaslamp and look forward to my future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location and great hotel. Friendly staff were very helpful from check in to the concierge who went out of her way to find great restaurants and shops. The feel of the hotel is very modern and the decor is great. We enjoyed the Enclave - a hotel within a hotel which was a 5 star experience. You can't go wrong at this property. We were planning to stay at another property and a friend encouraged us to try this hotel. We switched our reservation and are glad we did! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Way better than I expected.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. A smaller hotel (which is good IMHO), but has all the amenities of it's larger brethren across the street. Room service is fast and good, and it doesn't take 30 minutes to pull your car out of valet. winner, winner.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We love the Hilton San Diego Gaslamp Hotel! This is the second year we have partnered with them for our event, and we couldn't be happier. Our filmmakers, press, celebrities and Festival guests raved about the wonderful accomodations the Hilton San Diego Gaslamp Quarter provided. Their staff is well-trained, friendly, courteous, and goes out of their way to meet each guests' every need. The facility is always immaculate, and close to tons of shops and restaurants in the Gaslamp Quarter. If you are hosting an event or visiting San Diego, Hilton San Diego Gaslamp is the best possible hotel to stay at. Thank you, once again, for a wonderful experience! Robin

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton San Diego Gaslamp Quarter
HotelInfo.Address: 401 K Street, San Diego, CA 92101
